title: Customer Experience Technical & Analytical Support
description:
At BMW Group, everything starts with passion. It turns a profession into a vocation. It drives us to keep reinventing mobility and bring innovative ideas onto the roads. Enthusiasm for joint projects turns a team into a strong unit where every opinion is valued. It is only when expertise, highly professional processes and enjoyment of work unite that we can shape the future together.
 



  





 We are looking for a Customer Experience Technical & Analytical Support with the responsibility for providing advanced technical assistance and leveraging AI-driven analytics to enhance customer interactions and improve overall customer satisfaction. This role acts as a bridge between technical teams, customer-facing departments, markets and dealers – this to achieve seamless resolution of technical issues and data-driven decision-making powered by artificial intelligence. You will act as a technical support and system expert within the Customer Experience Team and are expected to collaborate with both CRM and CX across several departments and dealers.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Contact person for our partners on system-related topics, monitoring of data and development of processes. Responsible for system maintenance, optimization and integrations from the dealer network in Northern Europe (Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway and the three Baltic countries).
* Secure data quality and build relevant analysis in Voice of the Customer, for all markets and brands.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues related to CX applications and infrastructure. Act as a point of contact for escalated technical issues and ensure timely resolution. Monthly reporting of bonus programs, NPS and system training internally and to dealer groups.
* GDPR process support (Data subject Requests and Data Anonymization in system). Responsible for developing and improving the flow of customer data. Secure processes for data quality and survey participation.
* Analyze customer interaction data using AI and machine learning techniques to identify trends, pain points, and opportunities for improvement. Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and AI-powered analytics models.
* Visualize insights clearly and effectively to ensure that complex data is presented in a digestible way for our dealers, enabling quick understanding and action. Support the integration of new CX tools and technologies.



  





  





**What should you bring along?** 



* A few years’ experience of similar work chores, preferably in a matrix organization.
* Strong knowledge of CX platforms, CRM systems, and analytics tools, including AI and machine learning applications. Experience working with SalesForce, Qualtrics and NPS will be advantageous.
* Proficiency in data analysis software (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau) and AI/ML frameworks.
* Experience in technical support, data analysis, or related roles preferably within a customer experience environment.
* University degree in a relevant field, for example Systems Science or similar.
* Fluent in English and preferably in a Nordic language, written and verbally.



  





**To succeed in this role, we believe you are:** 



* Pro-active, self-driven and responsive person. You are both technical, communicative and enjoy working with many internal and external areas of contact.
* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Strong organizational and time management skills to maintain structure and drive initiatives.
* Positive team player with a holistic and winning mindset able to build trust and develop strong relationships.



  





 What you can look forward to?
 



 Whatever your heart’s desire – in the BMW Group, you will find a wide range of departments and disciplines across the world where you can share your professional passion with us.
 



  





 This is a permanent position located in Sollentuna, the premises are modern and include a lunch restaurant as well as access to a gym and group training classes. If you find this interesting and you’re bringing the right mind-set in combination with a good skill set, please don’t hesitate to apply!
 



  





 At the BMW Group, we place great importance on equal treatment and equal opportunities. Our recruiting decisions are based on the personality, experience, and skills of the applicants.

title: Area Manager
description:
At BMW Group, everything starts with passion. It turns a profession into a vocation. It drives us to keep reinventing mobility and bring innovative ideas onto the roads. Enthusiasm for joint projects turns a team into a strong unit where every opinion is valued. It is only when expertise, highly professional processes and enjoyment of work unite that we can shape the future together.
 



  





 We are looking for an Area Manager with the overall responsibility for daily correspondence and performance management between a number of dealers and BMW Group Sweden.
 



  





 The Area Manager is responsible for improving dealer operational efficiency, informing and consulting the dealers about BMW Group Northern Europe’s overall strategy and business plan.
 



  





 The function as Area Manager is a coaching role and part of the dealer’s business in terms of encouraging them to maximize business processes, customer satisfaction, volume and profitability.
 



 You will develop the business with a holistic and customer centric mindset. You will always be looking for new business development areas and developing sales processes to increase sales performance and coach our partners in a constant developing market environment.
 



  





**What awaits you?** 



* Improving dealer operational efficiency by implementing and following up on sales processes and strategies.
* Steering sales performance by delivering monthly reports and follow-ups on key metrics like volume and bonus targets, as well as sales funnel management.
* Defining and reaching targets for profitability, volume, and customer satisfaction.
* Establishing an overall business plan with budget, market, and activity plans.
* Initiating and carrying out activities to increase sales for the business.
* Analyzing sales development, profitability, and results per dealer, and when required, initiating and following up on action plans.



  





**What should you bring along?** 



* Experience in the car industry or a related field is advantageous; however, we encourage candidates with strong transferable skills and a passion for the automotive sector to apply.
* University diploma with a business or marketing qualification is a benefit, so is experience within the area of sales.
* The confidence and communication skills to engage with dealers and stakeholders in a constructive and collaborative manner.
* Strong leadership profile, preferable with experience from change management.
* Excel and PowerPoint with good presentation skills.
* Strong organizational and time management skills to maintain structure and proactively drive initiatives.



  





**To succeed in this role, we believe you are:** 



* A driven, results-oriented individual who can make tough decisions and guide our dealers towards success.
* Positive team player with a holistic and winning mindset able to build trust and develop strong relationships.
* KPI-driven and focused on delivering high-quality results at agreed deadlines.
* Proactive in identifying and addressing challenges or opportunities.



  





 You are a self-starter with a good communicative skill and take own initiatives. As a person you are service minded and enjoy a working day with high pace, your social skills are of great importance both towards dealers as well as within BMW Sweden. You have an excellent feeling for the brand and brand behavior is essential. The job requires flexible working patterns as some events or travel will be outside normal hours.
 



  





**What you can look forward to?** 




 Whatever your heart’s desire – in the BMW Group, you will find a wide range of departments and disciplines across the world where you can share your professional passion with us.
 



  





 This is a permanent position located in Sollentuna, the premises are modern and include a lunch restaurant as well as access to a gym and group training classes. If you find this interesting and you’re bringing the right mind-set in combination with a good skill set, please don’t hesitate to apply!
 



  





 At the BMW Group, we place great importance on equal treatment and equal opportunities. Our recruiting decisions are based on the personality, experience, and skills of the applicants.

title: Front Office-medarbetare
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Brinner du för service, administration och att skapa en inspirerande arbetsmiljö? Har du ett öga för detaljer och vill ha en roll där du kombinerar reception, kontorsansvar och eventsamarbete? Sopra Steria, ett av landets ledande IT-konsultbolag, som utsetts till en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser av Great Place To Work, söker nu en
 **Front Office-medarbetare** 
 till huvudkontoret i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

 I denna roll blir du navet på vårt kontor. Du ser till att arbetsplatsen alltid är representativ och trivsamt utformad, tar emot besökare med hög servicegrad, hanterar administrativa uppgifter och stöttar marknadsavdelningen inför interna och externa event. Rollen kräver att du är proaktiv, ser det stora i detaljerna och utforskar möjligheten att förbättra både service och arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**
* Ta emot och ta hand om besökare
* Hantera telefonsamtal, bud, post och leveranser
* Ordna kundluncher och interna event
* Stöttar med marknadsavdelningen inför interna och externa event
* Ansvara för inköp och se till att kontoret är snyggt, trivsamt och välskött
* Har helhetsansvar för intrycket av kontorets design
* Hantera delar i bolagets internkommunikation
* Utföra diverse administrativa uppgifter som stödjer medarbetare och verksamheten


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har några års erfarenhet av reception eller motsvarande med fokus på service
* Är proaktiv, initiativtagande och självgående
* Har en naturlig känsla för service och professionalism
* Är noggrann, ansvarstagande och har ett öga för detaljer
* Har känsla för arbetsplatsens uttryck och intresse av att skapa en trivsam miljö
* Är kommunikativ och förtroendeingivande


 Erfarenhet från liknande jobb inom servicebranschen är meriterande, men viktigast är din positiva attityd och vilja att bidra till en trivsam och välfungerande arbetsmiljö. Hos Sopra Steria vägleds vi av driv, nyfikenhet, kundfokus och hjärta. Vi hjälper varandra att lyckas eftersom vi vet att tillsammans når vi längre.
   

  

**Låter det här som din nästa utmaning?**
 Kul! Ansök genom att ladda upp ditt CV. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande, så vänta inte för länge.
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
 Den består av ett personlighets- och logiktest via Alva Labs samt två intervjuer. Vi genomför även referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll som en del av processen.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Emma Calderon, emma.calderon@soprasteria,com
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Senior Technical Support Engineer EMEA
description:
Zero Networks, a cutting-edge network security solutions provider, is at an exciting time in its history and is growing fast! At Zero Networks, we cherish the spirit of friendship, growth, excellence, transparency, and perseverance. We are seeking an experienced Support Engineer to be at the forefront of providing innovative and empathetic technical support to our customers. You will play a crucial role in ensuring customer satisfaction and driving the continuous improvement of our products and services. If you are a technical Support Engineer professional with a passion for working in a fast moving company, building a new support practice, and a challenging problem space in the cybersecurity industry, we invite you to join our team. Together, we can shape the future of network security. This is a fully remote position that can be hired anywhere in Europe.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

* Problem Solving: Diagnose and resolve technical issues, providing timely and accurate customer support.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to enhance product functionality and resolve customer challenges.
* Growth-Oriented Mindset: Continuously seek to improve your technical skills and knowledge, embracing our culture of learning and personal development.
* Quality Focus: Uphold high standards of service, striving for excellence in every customer interaction.
* Transparency and Communication: Maintain clear, empathetic, and effective communication with customers and team members.
* Perseverance: Tackle complex problems with a can-do attitude, demonstrating resilience in the face of challenges.


 Requirements:
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* 4+ years of relevant work experience (Network/Security/SaaS Support) - Must.
* Proficiency in Active Directory/GPO, Windows, Linux and PowerShell/ Python scripting - Must.
* Proven experience in technical support role, preferably in the cybersecurity industry.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
* Willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong understanding of network security skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Commitment to innovation, integrity, and excellence.

title: Experienced Cloud Strategy & Architecture Leader
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax, and related services. During its 175-year history, our organization has grown tremendously in both scale and capabilities. Deloitte currently has approximately 415,000 people in more than 150 countries and territories, and serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Yet, our shared culture and mission—to make an impact that matters—remains unchanged. This is evident not only in Deloitte’s work for clients, but also in our WorldClass ambition, our WorldClimate initiative and our ALL IN diversity and inclusion strategy.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

**Are you ready for the next step in your career and to join our team in Sweden?**
  

 Deloitte's business area Technology & Transformation Nordic is a market leader and works together with decision-makers in both global and local organizations. We support organizations in their challenges regarding strategy issues and in the implementation of complex transformations that often include major business-driven IT changes.
   

  

  

  

**Cloud Strategy & Architecture Leader**
  

 The Swedish Engineering Leader for Cloud Strategy and Architecture is responsible for overseeing the strategic direction and operational management and growth of Deloitte Sweden’s Cloud Strategy & Architecture offering. This includes driving business growth, managing financial performance, and delivering high-quality cloud services to our clients. The role involves building and nurturing client relationships, supporting technology partnerships, identifying market opportunities, sales and developing go-to-market strategies. Additionally, it requires leading a team of cloud professionals, fostering a culture of innovation, working cross-Nordics to grow the cloud program, and leading client engagement.
   

  

  





  

  

 At Deloitte you will be part of a wider global network of highly skilled Cloud specialists and work in advisory projects together with consultants across our Deloitte network.
   

  

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

**We seek people with interest in Cloud technology and related architecture, in combination with the following qualifications:**



* You are working and living in Sweden
* A relevant university master’s degree, preferably in engineering or computer science and 15+ years’ work experience
* Proficiency in Swedish and English and strong communication skills
* Proven experience in leading and managing cloud business units, with an emphasis cross-border
* Strong understanding of cloud technologies and industry trends
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills
* Strategic thinker with the ability to envision and implement growth strategies
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to grow a business


**Additional Information**

**What we offer**
  

 At Deloitte we focus on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths. By on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University and support from a personal coach, you will have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout your career. The way of working at Deloitte – our commitment to you.
   

  

  





**How to apply**
  

 Your application should consist of a CV and a cover letter and you apply directly online. Please apply as soon as possible as we will review the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

  





 As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.
   

  

  





**Questions?**
  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Christine Cederberg, chrcederberg@deloitte.se. For questions regarding the application process, please contact Anna Taube, ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





**We are looking forward to your application!**
  

  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Windows/Mac Client & System Engineer
description:
Nordnet is a leading pan-Nordic digital platform for savings and investments. Ever since we started in 1996, our purpose has been to democratize savings and investments. Through innovation, simplicity, and transparency, we challenge traditional ways in the financial industry, and give private savers access to the same information, tools and services as professionals. Our ambition is to inspire, encourage and enable people to take their savings to the next level, no matter who they are.
   

  

*Help us transform the way people save and invest. Become a part of journey to build an inspiring and innovative platform for savers and investors in the Nordics. Here's your opportunity!*
**In brief**
 We are looking for a Senior Windows/Mac Client & System Engineer to join Nordnets IT Support department. We currently have 5 engineers working in the team and are now looking for one more, with mainly Windows competence.
   

  

 IT Support's mission is twofolded
   

  

* Provide prompt and effective assistance to Nordnet personnel with IT equipment and software-related inquiries and issues.
* Proactively maintain the integrity, functionality, and security of client devices, mobile phones, meeting room equipment, and associated software, ensuring adherence to Nordnet's stringent security standards.


 IT Operations is comprised of various teams, and you will collaborate closely with them to effectively manage problems and drive progress on ongoing initiatives and projects.
   

  

**This is you**
 Most likely, you have a technical background that enables you to understand IT services on a deeper level. You have a strong passion for customer satisfaction. You like to communicate, and you have a true interest in building relations and creating result through your team.
   

  

 You should have several years of experience working with Clients (Mac/Win & Mobiles).
   

  

 Good knowledge of
   

  

* SCCM
* Intune
* Azure
* Jamf
* Google workspace


 You have an open mindset and a can-do attitude. Getting to know the details and understanding how everything is connected and dependent on each other is of great importance to you. You’re not afraid of rolling up your sleeves and love working in a fast-paced environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Client OS Configuration and deployment of Clients (Win/Mac & Mobile).
* Provide technical support to users and troubleshoot problems related to these clients.
* Deploy and manage software updates
* Troubleshoot hardware and software problems
* Document system configurations and procedures


 Former experience within Client OS Configuration is considered a huge advantage.
   

  

**About Nordnetters**
 We value experimentation and continuous improvement. With an impartial approach, we welcome new ideas to boost our progress. Sharing knowledge and learning from our setbacks is part of the game. We have the courage to ask questions and admit that we do not have the answer, all the time. We believe that straightforward and transparent communication build trust and inclusion.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer you the opportunity to work in a great team within a friendly Nordic environment with a strong focus on innovation, product development and technology. We are proud of the friendly and humble environment and commit to our goals as a team.
   

  

 We are 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 You can also visit us on: www.nordnet.se, www.nordnet.no, www.nordnet.dk and www.nordnet.fi.
   

  

**Application**
 If you have questions, please contact Head of IT-Support, Patrik Axelsson, patrik.axelsson@nordnet.se
   

  

 Apply today– Due to summer vacation we will start to review applications in the beginning of August and will get back to you with feedback as soon as possible. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Onsitetekniker
description:
Vi söker en erfaren Onsitetekniker med ett par års erfarenhet inom IT som vill ha en varierad ochutvecklande vardag med en bred roll och möjlighet att delta i eventuella IT-projekt. 
 



 SomOnsitetekniker får du en central roll där du både arbetar med teknik och mycketkontakt med användare, samtidigt som du bidrar till förbättringar ocheffektiviseringar inom ditt område. Vill du utvecklas inom IT, arbeta medfelsökning samt jobba hands on med tekniken? Då kan detta vara rätt möjlighetför dig!
 



**Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av:** 



* Active Directory, EntraID, Intune
* Felsökning av Windows 10/11 och Microsoft 365-applikationer
* On-och offboardingprocesser
* Enklare felsökning av nätverk/WiFi, laptops och skrivare
* Erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem och dokumentation
* Kan kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av MacOS och Jamf
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av konfiguration av server



**För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är:** 




 🌟 Innovativ – Ser möjligheter och hittar smartalösningar.
 



 🤝 Samarbetsvillig – Bidrar till en positivteamkultur.
 



 💡 Serviceinriktad – Brinner för att hjälpaanvändare.
 



 📋 Strukturerad – Arbetar systematiskt ochprioriterar väl.
 



  





**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   





**Placeringsort:** 
  Stockholm
 



**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  





**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
 



 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   





**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   





*Hoppas att du vill vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt!*

title: Experienced professionals to our Banking & Financial Services Engineering Team
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 We are seeking a skilled engineer with 2–4 years of experience to join our Banking & Financial Services Engineering team in Stockholm. You will work in Agile delivery set-ups, collaborating closely with product owners, business experts, and technology specialists to deliver high-value solutions for our clients.
   

  

  





 This role is ideal for candidates with both technical expertise and experience in product management roles (e.g. Product Owner, Scrum Master or Cloud Engineers) within core banking services and applications.
   

  

  





**What You’ll Do**



* Build, test, and implement technology solutions for leading banks and financial institutions.
* Work in Agile delivery teams, supporting iterative development and continuous improvement.
* Drive transformation projects in core banking, payments, cards, lending, compliance, and risk management.
* Collaborate across Deloitte’s Swedish and global practices to deliver future-proofed solutions.
* Act as a bridge between business and technology, contributing to product roadmaps and delivery.
* Ensure that technical solutions meet business needs as well as security and regulatory requirements.


**Qualifications**
* 2–4 years of experience in software engineering, technology consulting, or systems implementation.
* Prior experience as a Product Owner, Scrum Master or Engineering roles within core banking services/applications is highly valued.
* Background in banking / financial services projects (core banking systems, payments, risk, compliance, or similar).
* Hands-on experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum, SAFe, Kanban).
* Proficiency in one or more programming languages (Java, .NET, Python, etc.).
* Knowledge of APIs, microservices, and/or cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
* Strong analytical and communication skills with the ability to work in dynamic, collaborative teams.
* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent.
* Fluent in English; Swedish language skills are a strong advantage.


**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to work with Sweden’s largest financial services clients in Agile delivery set-ups.
* A collaborative and inclusive workplace at our Stockholm office, with hybrid flexibility.
* Continuous learning and professional development, including certifications in Agile, cloud, and financial services.
* Competitive compensation and benefits tailored to the Swedish market.
* Clear career growth opportunities within Deloitte’s Financial Services and Engineering practices.


  

  

  


**Ready to Make an Impact?**




 If you’re passionate about engineering, Agile delivery, and product ownership within banking, Deloitte Sweden offers the platform to accelerate your career and shape the future of financial services.
   

  

  




**Additional Information**

**How to Apply:**




 You apply online. Your application should consist of:
   

  

  




* CV
* Letter of motivation
	+ Why you are interested in Deloitte and the role as a consultant
	+ What you think you can contribute with and bring to the role


**Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we work with ongoing selection.**
  

  

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.* 
*https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*
  

  

  

**Questions?**

 If you have any questions regarding the role or the application process, please contact Linn Halmstrand, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  

  

  

**We are looking forward to your application!**
  

  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Senior Nätverkstekniker
description:
Vill du arbeta med avancerade nätverkslösningar och få ansvar för att säkerställa en stabil och säker IT-miljö? Vi söker en erfaren nätverkstekniker som vill vara med och optimera, underhålla och utveckla nätverksinfrastrukturen.
 



 Som senior nätverkstekniker ansvarar du för planering, implementering och optimering av nätverkslösningar. Du leder felsökning, förbättringsprojekt och säkerhetsåtgärder, samt bidrar med expertkunskap i strategiska beslut för infrastrukturen.
   




**Kvalifikationer** 
* Djup kompetens inom routing och switching
* Brandväggar och säkerhetslösningar (Fortigate, Palo Alto, Check Point)
* VPN, SD-WAN och nätverkssegmentering
* Wi-Fi-design och implementation (Cisco, Aruba)
* Nätverksövervakning och analys (SNMP, NetFlow, Wireshark)
* Lastbalansering och redundanslösningar
* Erfarenhet av IT-säkerhetsrutiner och policyimplementering
* Förmåga att dokumentera och designa nätverksarkitektur
* Kan kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift



 Meriterande:
 


* Certifieringar inom CCNA, CCNP eller CCIE
* Erfarenhet av scripting och automatisering



**Som person** 
 är du problemlösande och har en stark förmåga att hantera utmaningar på ett strukturerat sätt. Du är målmedveten, ansvarstagande och tar egna initiativ för att driva ditt arbete framåt. Samtidigt värdesätter du samarbete, har lätt för att bygga relationer och bidrar aktivt till en positiv arbetskultur.
 



**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   





**Placeringsort:** 
  Stockholm
 



**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  





**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
 



 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   





**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   





*Hoppas att du vill vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt!*

title: Erfaren specialist för utveckling av system inom försvarsindustrin
description:
Välkommen till Knowit Dataunit!
   

  

**Vi är ett innovativt, modernt och jämställt bolag som arbetar tillsammans för att leverera de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder. Hos Knowit får du växa och arbeta tillsammans med kunniga kollegor samtidigt som du är med och gör skillnad i samhället.**
 Vi har hjälpt kunder med lösningar inom försvarssystem i över 30 år och söker nu fler till vårt team. Våra kunder kommer till oss när de är i behov av system som har höga krav på tillgänglighet och som används i krävande miljöer. Vi arbetar i projektteam med strukturerade processer och även i projekt med ett agilt arbetssätt.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och ser gärna att du är en person som drivs av att skapa kundnytta och alltid har kundens bästa i fokus. Ansvarstagande och noggrannhet är ytterligare några av dina ledord. Vi tror att du har stor personlig integritet och ett metodiskt arbetssätt. Du trivs med att arbeta i team, samverka med andra och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap.
   

  

 Att jobba på Knowit:
   

  

 Vad kan vi erbjuda dig? Härliga kollegor, kreativt arbete, intressanta kunder både i Sverige och utomlands, utrymme för att dela med sig av kunskap och möjlighet till personlig utveckling. Vi värdesätter en trygg och öppen kultur och tycker det är viktigt att våra medarbetare har möjlighet att kombinera arbete och fritid.
   

  

* Flexibla arbetstider
* Arbete på distans eller i moderna lokaler centralt i Stockholm
* Friskvård
* Privat vårdförsäkring
* Bra pensionslösning
* Möjlighet att ta del av förmånliga försäkringsprogram


 Vill du bli en av oss?
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling av komplexa IT-system med höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet, gärna tio år eller mer.
* Flera års erfarenhet av strukturerat krav- och designarbete gärna i någon av rollerna projektledare, systemarkitekt, systemutvecklare eller testare.
* Goda kunskaper i att dokumentera på svenska
* På grund av krav kopplade till försvarssekretess krävs svenskt medborgarskap för denna roll.


 Vi värdesätter också att du har:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Programmeringskunskaper i något av språken C#, C++, eller Java
* Erfarenhet från försvarsindustrin eller försvaret


 Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan redan idag. Varmt välkommen!

title: VMware Engineer
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och strukturerad VMware Engineer till en tekniktung miljö med höga säkerhetskrav. Uppdraget omfattar en omfattande migrering från en extern till en intern VMware-miljö, där fokus ligger på stabilitet, kvalitet och effektiv implementering utifrån en definierad grunddesign.
 



 Kunden är en samhällskritisk aktör inom betalningsinfrastruktur, vilket ställer höga krav på säkerhet, samarbetsförmåga och noggrannhet.
 


 Arbetsuppgifter
 * Migrera från extern till intern VMware-miljö enligt fastställda metoder.
* Följa och förbättra migreringsrunbooks och körscheman.
* Utföra arbetsmoment utanför kontorstid vid behov (inom servicefönster).
* Hantera incidenter och säkerställa att lösningar följer IT-arkitektur och säkerhetsriktlinjer.
* Dokumentera förändringar och bidra till processutveckling.


 Kravprofil
 * Mycket god kunskap inom VMware Cloud Foundation (vSphere, vSAN, NSX, Avi Load Balancer).
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom nätverk, Active Directory, DNS, Windows och Linux.
* Strukturerat arbetssätt och vana att dokumentera.
* Erfarenhet av incidenthantering och arbete enligt säkerhetsstandarder.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.
* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande kompetens.


 Meriterande
 * Erfarenhet av arbete i säkerhetsklassad miljö.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av större VMware-migreringar.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och förbättra migreringsmetodiker och dokumentation.


 Personliga egenskaper
 
 Vi söker dig som är självgående och tar initiativ, samtidigt som du har lätt för att samarbeta och kommunicera med andra. Du har ett analytiskt och lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt, är kvalitetsmedveten och har ett starkt säkerhetstänk som genomsyrar ditt arbete.
   





**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn 1 månads uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   





**Placeringsort:** 
  Stockholm
 



**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  





**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
 



 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   





**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.

title: Windows/Mac Client & System Engineer
description:
Nordnet is a leading pan-Nordic digital platform for savings and investments. Ever since we started in 1996, our purpose has been to democratize savings and investments. Through innovation, simplicity, and transparency, we challenge traditional ways in the financial industry, and give private savers access to the same information, tools and services as professionals. Our ambition is to inspire, encourage and enable people to take their savings to the next level, no matter who they are.
   

  

*Help us transform the way people save and invest. Become a part of journey to build an inspiring and innovative platform for savers and investors in the Nordics. Here's your opportunity!*
**In brief**
 We are looking for a Senior Windows/Mac Client & System Engineer to join Nordnets IT Support department. We currently have 5 engineers working in the team and are now looking for one more, with mainly Windows competence.
   

  

 IT Support's mission is twofolded
   

  

* Provide prompt and effective assistance to Nordnet personnel with IT equipment and software-related inquiries and issues.
* Proactively maintain the integrity, functionality, and security of client devices, mobile phones, meeting room equipment, and associated software, ensuring adherence to Nordnet's stringent security standards.


 IT Operations is comprised of various teams, and you will collaborate closely with them to effectively manage problems and drive progress on ongoing initiatives and projects.
   

  

**This is you**
 Most likely, you have a technical background that enables you to understand IT services on a deeper level. You have a strong passion for customer satisfaction. You like to communicate, and you have a true interest in building relations and creating result through your team.
   

  

 You should have several years of experience working with Clients (Mac/Win & Mobiles).
   

  

 Good knowledge of
   

  

* SCCM
* Intune
* Azure
* Jamf
* Google workspace


 You have an open mindset and a can-do attitude. Getting to know the details and understanding how everything is connected and dependent on each other is of great importance to you. You’re not afraid of rolling up your sleeves and love working in a fast-paced environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Client OS Configuration and deployment of Clients (Win/Mac & Mobile).
* Provide technical support to users and troubleshoot problems related to these clients.
* Deploy and manage software updates
* Troubleshoot hardware and software problems
* Document system configurations and procedures


 Former experience within Client OS Configuration is considered a huge advantage.
   

  

**About Nordnetters**
 We value experimentation and continuous improvement. With an impartial approach, we welcome new ideas to boost our progress. Sharing knowledge and learning from our setbacks is part of the game. We have the courage to ask questions and admit that we do not have the answer, all the time. We believe that straightforward and transparent communication build trust and inclusion.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer you the opportunity to work in a great team within a friendly Nordic environment with a strong focus on innovation, product development and technology. We are proud of the friendly and humble environment and commit to our goals as a team.
   

  

 We are 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 You can also visit us on: www.nordnet.se, www.nordnet.no, www.nordnet.dk and www.nordnet.fi.
   

  

**Application**
 If you have questions, please contact Head of IT-Support, Patrik Axelsson, patrik.axelsson@nordnet.se
   

  

 Apply today– Due to summer vacation we will start to review applications in the beginning of August and will get back to you with feedback as soon as possible. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Junior Designer
description:
*Sellpy is searching for someone with a sharp eye and a genuine interest in design and new technologies.* 




  





 We offer an agency-like way of working with an ever-present purpose – where every kerned heading, every thumb-stopper, and every prompt helps convince more people that the future of fashion is circular. Enough to make your grandma and future grandchildren equally proud.
 



  





 You are a curious person with a portfolio that proves your skills. You understand typography and design fundamentals, and you’re eager to learn more about generative AI. You are structured, easy to work with, and not afraid to roll up your sleeves in a fast-paced environment. You’re comfortable taking on smaller projects yourself but also enjoy contributing to bigger productions alongside art directors and other creatives.
 



  





**In short, you will** 



* Design and adapt campaign assets to fit various formats and languages
* Contribute to the ideation process
* Create content for social media
* Be part of and contribute to photo shoots



  





**You need** 



* At least 1 year of experience at an ad agency, design firm or relevant in-house department
* Solid understanding of typography and visual design
* Skills in retouch and basic photo editing
* Experience with generative AI tools for imagery and footage
* A portfolio that shows all of the above



  





**We’d be impressed if you are** 



* Skilled in motion design and video editing
* Seasoned with tools like Midjourney, Runway and Nano Banana
* Experienced in assisting at photo shoots



  





**You’ll get to** 



* Be part of a young brand that’s driving change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you’ll get direction, energy, and the chance to work on meaningful challenges on a daily basis
* Work closely with a creative director, two art directors, a copywriter, a motion designer, a designer, and a project manager, as well as with external production partners
* Relax with 30 days of paid vacation
* Use staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands
* Thrive in a social and driven people culture



  





**Location** 




 You are welcome to do all these things at our office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm, and from home. We hope that you are based in the Stockholm area for you to attend campaign shoots and similar events.
 



  





**Hybrid work** 




 We work in a flexible hybrid setup, spending at least half of our time together in the office to keep ideas flowing and the team spirit strong
 



  





**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time, temporary
 



  





**Start:** 
 As agreed upon
 



  





 Send in your application and a link to your portfolio and let’s take it from there.

title: Head of Operations – International
description:
**Who We Are** 




 SiriusPoint is a global underwriter of insurance and reinsurance. We utilize deep risk capabilities to protect our customers and provide intelligent risk solutions to clients and brokers around the world. Bermuda-headquartered and listed on the New York Stock Exchange (SPNT), we work as ‘One SiriusPoint’, to apply expertise and underwrite risks across our four operational areas - International Insurance, North American Insurance, Global Accident and Health, and Global Reinsurance.
 



 We have underwriting hubs in Bermuda, Liege, London, New York, Stockholm and Toronto, and licenses to write Property & Casualty and Accident & Health insurance and reinsurance globally.
 



  





**Join Our Team** 




 The Head of Operations – International will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations of the International business unit, ensuring efficiency and effectiveness in all operational aspects. This role involves strategic planning, managing operational processes and collaborating with various departments to drive operational excellence be they locally driven or part of a Group change initiative. The Head of Operations – International will report directly to the CEO and play a critical role in the company's growth and success.
 




 Your responsibilities will include:
 



* Operational Management: Oversee and manage the company's operational processes, ensuring they are efficient and effective.
* Strategic Planning: Develop and implement operational strategies that align with the company's goals and objectives.
* Performance Metrics: Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational efficiency and effectiveness.
* Project Management: Lead and manage key projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Regulatory Compliance: Ensure the implementation of any regulatory changes and compliance with relevant regulations and standard, working with the subject matter experts in the central functions.
* Underwriting Process: Act as the guardian of the end-to-end underwriting process review work, ensuring compliance to required service levels through monitoring management information (MI) and driving improvements.
* Issue Spotting: Identify and address operational issues promptly to ensure smooth business operations.
* Credit Control: Support the implementation of credit control processes to manage and mitigate financial risks.
* Change Management: Assess the impact of change programs and coach teams to effectively implement these changes.
* Customer Operationalization: Develop and operationalize processes to enable the company to engage in consumer business effectively.
* Risk Management: Identify and mitigate operational risks to ensure business continuity.
* Team Leadership: Build and maintain a high-performance culture through effective leadership, communication, and collaboration.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with other departments and stakeholders to drive operational improvements and support business objectives.
* Continuous Improvement: Promote a culture of continuous improvement, identifying opportunities for operational enhancements and implementing best practices.
* Departmental Integration: Facilitate effective communication and collaboration between adjacent departments such as marketing, IT, Underwriting, Risk, and others to ensure cohesive and aligned operations



  





**United behind common goals** 




 At SiriusPoint we work as one team across our global business, and we unite that team behind common goals, understanding the positive impact we can all make at SiriusPoint. We aim to retain and attract great people, knowing they can achieve a rewarding and enriching career.
 



**Our Purpose** 
 is to provide security and resilience in an uncertain world.
 



**Our Vision** 
 is to be recognized as a best-in-class insurer and reinsurer utilizing deep risk capabilities to protect our customers. Blending our talent, expertise and data to provide intelligent risk solutions.
 



**Our culture** 
 is one of performance and accountability. Our people are our experts and you will be empowered to apply your expertise in a supportive, collaborative and purposeful environment.
 



**Our Values** 
 are at the heart of our business, and which guide every day actions and decision making.
 


* Integrity: Integrity, respect and trust are our core principles
* Customer Focused: Our customers are the reason we exist
* Solution Driven: Creating solutions is our mindset
* Diversity: Diversity, inclusion and allyship make us stronger
* Collaboration: Collaboration drives outperformance



  






 Your skills and abilities should include:
 




 Qualifications:
 


* Education: A Degree is preferred or relevant business experience.
* Experience: Demonstrable experience in operations management in a leadership role.
* Skills:
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Excellent strategic planning and project management abilities.
* Proficiency in operational performance metrics and KPIs.
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of regulatory requirements and risk management practices.
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.



 Personal Attributes:
 


* Innovative: Ability to think creatively and drive innovative solutions.
* Detail-Oriented: Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality.
* Resilient: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Proactive: Self-motivated and able to take initiative.
* Engaging: Ability to explain and drive successful change delivery



  





**Why Should You Join SiriusPoint?** 




 Our people are our experts, and from day one you will be empowered to apply your expertise in a supportive, collaborative, and purposeful environment. Our Values - Integrity, Customer Focused, Solution Driven, Diversity, and Collaboration - are at the heart of our business, and they guide our everyday actions and decision making. We also unite our global team behind common goals, ensuring you can make a meaningful impact.
 



 We aim to retain and attract great people, knowing they can achieve a rewarding and enriching career. We offer a competitive and above market compensation package.
 



  





**We Achieve More Together** 




 At SiriusPoint, we know that diversity, inclusion and allyship make us stronger. We value and are committed to supporting the unique voices, backgrounds, cultures, lifestyles, and contributions of the diverse global employee base that make up our business.
 



 We know that a diverse and equitable culture, where all voices are included and heard, is critical to our success as an employer. We are committed to developing our DE&I strategy to ensure that SiriusPoint remains a supportive and empowering place of work.

title: System Engineer
description:
**TFS HealthScience** 
 is a global, mid-sized Contract Research Organization (CRO) that partners with biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies throughout their clinical development journey. Our expertise covers full-service solutions, resourcing, and functional service provider (FSP) offerings.
   

  

 We are now seeking a System Engineer
 **(GMP)** 
 to join our team. This assignment involves working on-site with one of our pharmaceutical manufacturing clients. In this role, you will have overall responsibility for the operation, maintenance, and further development of several IT and data systems used in a GMP-regulated environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage the administration and operation of IT systems linked to regulatory activities
* Ensure data systems comply with current GMP requirements and regulatory guidelines
* Perform qualification and validation of new and existing systems
* Act as an expert resource during inspections and audits from authorities and clients
* Plan and coordinate maintenance, upgrades, and development projects related to data systems
* Handle license administration and documentation
* Contribute to the development of procedures and governing documents (SOPs)
* Train users on systems and support the creation of training materials
* Collaborate with both internal IT functions and external vendors on technical matters and procurement


**System Environment (examples Of Systems In This Role)**
 ECM, Chromeleon, PCS 1, MassLynx, Chemstation, Malvern Mastersizer, Unicorn Äkta Pure, Intab, Panalytical Xpert Pro XRPD, STARe, MicroDiss, Modde, Chemdraw, among others.
   

  

**Your Profile**
* Experience working with data systems in GMP-regulated operations
* Strong understanding of requirements for data management, data integrity, and audit trail in regulated environments
* Experience with validation and qualification of computerized systems
* Ability to document work in line with regulatory requirements and draft governing documents
* Previous experience with inspections and audits is advantageous
* Excellent proficiency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written


**What We Offer**
 We offer a stimulating consulting role where you will have the opportunity to grow both professionally and personally. You will be part of an engaged team where collaboration, competence development, and high quality are central.
   

  

**About TFS HealthScience**
 Founded in Lund over 27 years ago, TFS has grown into a global full-service CRO with more than 800 employees across 40+ countries. We provide flexible solutions in clinical development and strategic resourcing across multiple therapeutic areas such as dermatology, neuroscience, oncology, and ophthalmology.
   

  

 Our values —
 **Trust, Quality, Passion, Flexibility, and Sustainability** 
 — guide everything we do and help us build strong, dedicated teams that make a difference together.
   

  

**Together we make a difference.**

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**GCP requirements:**
 Familiar with Vertex AI pipeline/kubeflow pipelines
   

  

 Familiar with BigQuery,
   

  

 can code SQL
   

  

 Familiar with Cloud composer / airflow
   

  

 Familiar with IAM, service account
   

  

 Familiar with Data catalog
   

  

 Understand Infrastructure as Code
   

  

 Good to have knowledge with Dataflow, and K8s.

 Familiar with Cloud composer / airflow
   

  

**Python:**
 Deep knowledge about python programing, practice OOP, following coding best practice, know how to use flake8, mypy, black, SonarQube and pre-commit
   

  

 Deep knowledge in unit test and end to end test, familiar with Pytest, fixtures, unittest etc
   

  

**Unix:**
 Familiar with popular Unix system, know how to install sth in docker.
   

  

 Familiar with shell

 Know how to create PR and solve merge conflict.
   

  

 Can create CI/CD pipeline in either Github Action using best practice
   

  

**Docker**
 Deep understanding with Docker
   

  

**DBT**

**SQL**
 Deep knowledge of SQL
   

  

 Deep understanding with Data modeling, system design
   

  

**Required cloud certification:** 
 Professional Machine Learning Engineers
   

  

 Experience with high-availability APIs, machine learning–based recommendation, and personalization systems is considered a
 **merit.**
**Application deadline:** 
 12-09-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: IT Management Consultant
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Come work with us** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**What does it mean to be an IT Management Consultant at Netlight?** 




 It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar. For example as an IT Project Manager, Product Owner, Team Lead, Tech Lead, IT-Architect, IT-Infrastructure, Scrum Master, Product Manager or similar? And from there... It is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like.
 



  





 As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.
 



  





 As an IT Management Consultant, you will most likely take projects in the area as Scrum Master, IT Project Manager, Product Owner, Product Manager, IT Architect, IT Infrastructure, Team Lead, Tech Lead, Technical Due Diligence, Agile coaching and other leadership roles in tech.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
* Verbal and written fluency in English and Swedish (or Danish/Norwegian)
* 0,5-5 years of work experience related to building software products together with software developers in agile teams
* Proven track-record from previous positions (e.g. recognized achievements & deliveries)



  





**Application** 




 We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We try to get in touch within two weeks
 
 if
 
 we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

title: Design Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $100M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We’re hiring a Design Engineer to help us build the most beautiful and intuitive legal platform in the world. You’ll work across the gap between design and frontend—crafting polished, interactive experiences that make AI feel natural, collaborative, and human. Your job is to bring clarity, motion, and refinement to every corner of the interface.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Build elegant, reusable UI with React, TypeScript, and CSS
* Translate Figma designs into refined, real product experiences
* Prototype and explore new interaction patterns—especially around AI workflows
* Add motion and micro-interactions that bring interfaces to life
* Shape our design system alongside designers and engineers
* Raise the visual and interaction quality across the product


 Who you are
   

  

* Strong experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS
* Deep interest in UI design, motion, and detail
* A portfolio that shows taste, craft, and interaction thinking
* Curiosity about how AI changes the way people interact with software
* Drive to build interfaces that are fast to use and delightful to use


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Informationssäkerhetskonsult
description:
Plats
   

  

 Linköping, Norrköping, Stockholm + 3 , På plats
   

  

 Upplägg
   

  

 Heltid
   

  

 Ansök senast
   

  

 Löpande rekrytering
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss får du en nyckelroll i en växande säkerhetsverksamhet där du bland annat kommer att:
   

  

* Leda och delta i uppdrag inom informationssäkerhet, regelefterlevnad och ledningssystem.
* Tolka och implementera etablerade ramverk och regelverk, samt omsätta dem i praktiska lösningar.
* Ta fram och införa policys, rutiner, riskanalyser och förbättringsplaner.
* Bidra i uppdrag som CISO as a Service och stötta organisationer i att bygga upp sin säkerhetsstyrning.


**Erfarenhet och kompetens**
 Vi tror att du har minst 6 års erfarenhet inom informationssäkerhet, compliance, dataskydd eller IT-styrning, med god förståelse för både verksamhetens behov och tekniska lösningar.
   

  

 Din kompetens
   

  

 Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med GDPR, NIS2, DORA och liknande regelverk.
   

  

 God kännedom om ramverk som ISO 27000-serien, NIST eller motsvarande.
   

  

 Förmåga att skapa styrdokument samt genomföra riskhantering och informationsklassificering.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av CISO-roller eller att bygga upp ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet (LIS).
   

  

 Flytande svenska i tal och skrift
   

  

 Fördelar hos Consid
   

  

 Centralt kontor
   

  

 Din arbetsplats är en mötesplats med vackra lokaler som dessutom är centralt belägna med goda förbindelser.
   

  

 Bred kundbas
   

  

 Med kunder inom både offentlig och privat sektor och med över 150 ramavtal får du variation och trygghet.
   

  

 Kompetenshubbar
   

  

 Med kontors- och landsövergripande kompetenshubbar finns ständigt möjlighet till kompetensutbyte.
   

  

 Utvecklas
   

  

 Hos oss finns möjlighet att testa det som du är intresserad av och utveckla din roll i den riktning du vill.

title: IT Service Manager, Nätverk och Fastighets-IT
description:
Vill du vara med att forma framtidens digitala fastigheter och samtidigt göra verklig skillnad för både människor och samhälle?
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vill du vara med att forma framtidens digitala fastigheter och samtidigt göra verklig skillnad för både människor och samhälle? I denna spännande roll får du kombinera teknik, innovation och hållbarhet!
   

  

 Alecta Fastigheter befinner sig på en spännande digital resa där innovation, hållbarhet och teknik går hand i hand. Nu finns chansen att kliva in i en nyckelroll som IT Service Manager, där du får kombinera strategiskt tänkande med operativt ansvar och vara med och bygga morgondagens smarta och hållbara fastigheter.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Som IT Service Manager blir du en central del av teamet Digitalisering & IT. Här får du driva utvecklingen av fastighetsnära IT-infrastruktur, från nätverk, fiber och mobilförstärkning till edge-enheter och framtida digitala koncept.
   

  

**I Rollen Kommer Du Att**
* Ansvara för förvaltning, utveckling och säkerhet för vårt koncept inom fastighetsnära IT
* Driva förbättringar i processer, ärendehantering och leverantörssamarbeten
* Säkerställa regelefterlevnad, dokumentation och en robust IT-miljö
* Arbeta nära de tekniska fastighetsutvecklare som ansvarar för olika delar av vårt fastighetsbestånd


 Din vardag innebär nära dialog med både externa leverantörer, entreprenörer i våra fastigheter och kollegor inom fastighetsteknik, en variationsrik roll med många kontaktytor.
   

  

**Din profil**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT
* Flerårig erfarenhet av nätverk, IT-infrastruktur och leverantörsstyrning
* God förståelse för säkerhetskraven i fastighets- och tekniska system
* Vana vid förvaltningsplaner, budgetuppföljning och systemförvaltning


 Som person är du nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och ansvarstagande. Du trivs i en roll där strategi och hands-on arbete möts och där du får bidra med nya idéer som driver utvecklingen framåt.
   

  

 Om Alecta Fastigheter
   

  

 Alecta Fastigheter är ett av Sveriges största fastighetsbolag och befinner sig på en spännande tillväxtresa. All avkastning går tillbaka till Alectas cirka 2,8 miljoner pensionssparare över hela Sverige, ett ansvar som knyter verksamheten direkt till framtida generationer.
   

  

 Som ungt bolag satsar Alecta Fastigheter på att bygga en stark, inkluderande och modig organisation där människor får växa, inspireras och nå sin fulla potential. Kulturen präglas av engagemang, samarbete och modet att tänka nytt.
   

  

**Ansök enkelt med ditt CV**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Alecta Fastigheter med Inhouse IT & Tech.
   

  

* Tillsvidareanställning på heltid
* Placering: Alecta Fastigheters kontor i centrala Stockholm
* Ansökan sker via www.inhouse.se – personligt brev behövs inte, ditt CV räcker.


 Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte med att söka! Har du frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Louise Hagen Furugård, louise.furugard@inhouse.se, 073-311 87 26. Ansök här

title: Experienced professionals to our Insurance Engineering Team
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

**Are you ready for the next step in your career and to be part of our successful team in Sweden?**




 Deloitte is seeking talented early-career professionals with 1–3 years of experience in the insurance industry who are eager to advance their skills in IT-enabled business transformation.
   

  

  





 As part of our Engineering team in Stockholm, you will collaborate closely with clients and Deloitte colleagues to plan and implement core business solutions that enhance operational efficiency and foster innovation. Leveraging your insurance domain expertise alongside strong technical and/or project management capabilities, you will lead and coordinate key activities across system design, development, testing, and deployment. You will also manage stakeholder engagement, oversee change management processes, ensure alignment with business objectives, and drive continuous improvement throughout the transformation lifecycle.
   

  

  





 Your background may include roles such as claims handler, IT business analyst, system implementation specialist, or similar positions within insurance. Experience in project management, test management, product management, or software development is highly valued. While not mandatory, familiarity with AI and cloud technologies is considered an advantage.
   

  

  





 This role offers a unique opportunity to deepen your expertise across both business and technology domains by contributing to IT-driven transformation projects that help clients modernize operations and adopt emerging technologies. You will work alongside experienced consultants and industry experts in a dynamic consulting environment.
   

  

  





**Core Responsibilities**




 Your core responsibilities will typically be:
   

  

  




* Lead workstreams or smaller projects within large-scale IT core transformation projects/programs
* Design, establish, and manage PMO functions to support large-scale transformations
* Engage and manage key stakeholders to enhance our understanding of client needs and build lasting relationships
* Ensure continuous alignment between project delivery and enterprise strategies
* Drive core project management activities, including planning, reporting, resource and risk management, budgeting, and financial oversight
* Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including developers, testers business stakeholders and vendors
* Engage in continuous learning and professional development opportunities


**Qualifications**
* 1–3 years of professional experience within the insurance sector
* Graduate degree and proficiency in technology and business disciplines
* Relevant experience in system implementation, IT business analysis, system analysis, claims handling, insurance advisory, or similar operational roles
* Demonstrated interest or experience in IT transformations, project management, test management, product management, requirements management, data migration, software development, ITIL, and agile methodologies
* Understanding of end-to-end insurance related business processes
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively within team-oriented, client-facing environments
* Strong motivation to learn and develop professionally in a fast-paced consulting setting
* Basic knowledge and keen interest in AI and cloud technologies is considered an advantage
* Proficient user of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word, with the ability to leverage these tools effectively in a professional context
* Professional proficiency in Swedish and English, both oral and written
* Flexibility to travel as required


**Additional Information**

**We offer**




 At Deloitte, we are committed to helping our employees grow and develop throughout their career. We offer a range of on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University, and access to a personal coach to support you in identifying and utilizing your strengths. We also provide the necessary training and resources for you to obtain various certifications to further advance in your career.
   

  

  

  

 Our culture is built on collaboration and innovation. We value diverse perspectives and encourage our employees to think creatively to find the best solutions for our clients. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to understand their unique needs and to develop tailored solutions that drive growth and innovation. At Deloitte, you´ll have the chance to grow and succeed alongside like-minded professionals who share your passion.
   

  

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

**How to Apply:**




 You apply online. Your application should consist of:
   

  

  




* CV
* Letter of motivation
	+ Why you are interested in Deloitte and the role as a consultant
	+ What you think you can contribute with and bring to the role


**Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we work with ongoing selection.**
  

  

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.* 
*https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*
  

  

  

**Questions?**

 If you have any questions regarding the role or the application process, please contact Linn Halmstrand, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  

  

  

**We are looking forward to your application!**
  

  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: AI Engineer (Contract)
description:
**About Filed**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating
 **fast-growing, sticky revenue** 
 , and are
