* **Compliance:** 
 Ensure compliance with all relevant accounting standards - IFRS at Group level, and local GAAPs where applicable; ensuring your entities are compliant with relevant financial controls and regulatory requirements for licensed entities
* **Financial Reporting:** 
 Drafting or reviewing year end financial statements, and preparing financial reports for local board meetings on your entities
* **Project Collaboration:** 
 Actively participate in finance-related projects both for your own entities, but also as the finance contact on larger projects, contributing accounting expertise and ensuring financial implications are considered
* **Process Improvement:** 
 Identify and implement improvements to accounting processes and internal controls to enhance efficiency and accuracy



  




**Who you are** 
* Professional accounting qualification (e.g., ACA, ACCA or equivalent)
* Proven experience in a financial accounting role with responsibility for month-end and year-end close
* Strong technical knowledge of IFRS and UK GAAP is essential (Any knowledge of Turkish GAAP is desirable but not essential)
* Experience managing external audits and dealing with regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail
* Proficiency in accounting software (preferably Netsuite) and strong Excel skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced international environment, with strong communication and interpersonal skills






  




  


**Our Fantastic Benefits
 
 (varies by location)
 

 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 




 ☕
 **O** 

**n-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 



  





**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact
 
 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.**********

title: Cashier Stockholm
description:
**Description**
 Ria Money Transfer, a business segment of Euronet Worldwide, Inc. (NASDAQ: EEFT), delivers innovative financial services including fast, secure, and affordable global money transfers to millions of customers along with currency exchange, mobile top-up, bill payment and check cashing services, offering a reliable omnichannel experience. With over 600,000 locations in nearly 200 countries and territories, our purpose remains to open ways for a better everyday life.
   

  

 We believe we can create a world in which people are empowered to build the life they dream of, no matter who they are or where they are. One customer, one family, one community at a time.
   

  

**About This Role**
 As a Cashier, in Ria Money Transfer Sweden your role will be to provide the most trustworthy, easy and pleasant experiences for our customers. Always facing our customers directly, our retail team is the face of our company and one of our most vibrant teams.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities**
* Interact with customers face to face to receive and process all of Ria’s products such as money transfers, money orders, selling and buying foreign currency.
* Accurately verify or enter the customer’s information on our systems.
* Courteously assist customers with various inquiries such as questions about our services, service cancellations or other Ria locations.
* Recognize problems, issues or complaints during queries and propose solutions or escalate to the management team.
* Keep up to date with Ria’s products, services, and policies.
* Balance your cash register and prepare cash for bank deposit.
* Prepare your daily transactions record.
* Perform other duties as assigned or requested by your colleagues and superiors.


**Position Requirements**
* Ability to work flexible schedules, including weekends.
* Some computer knowledge with ability to use MS Word and Excel.
* Cash handling experience is highly preferred.
* Strong customer service skills.
* A valid work permit is a must


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Ria, we believe in rewarding our team with more than just a paycheck. Here’s what you can look forward to:
   

  

**Work-Life Balance & Fun**
* Exciting Social Events & Seasonal Celebrations – Because work should be fun too!
* A Day Off on Your Birthday – Enjoy your special day on us!


*Growth & Development*
* Regular Leadership Training – Unlock your full potential
* Internal & External Learning Opportunities – Keep growing, keep succeeding
* Internal & International Mobility Opportunities – Your career, your way


*Rewards & Recognition*
* Annual Employee Recognition Events & Performance Rewards – Your hard work deserves the spotlight
* ESPP (Employee Stock Purchase Plan) – Invest in your future with us
* Exclusive Discounts on Company Products & Services – Enjoy perks beyond the workplace


*Wellbeing & Giving Back*
* Wellness Allowance – Take care of your health with extra support
* Employee Wellness Weeks – Prioritizing your health, always


*Ready to be part of something great? Join us and let's make work exciting, rewarding, and meaningful together!*
 Ria Money Transfer is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
   

  

 Check out our website to learn more about the company at:
 **http://www.riamoneytransfer.com/**
 The position responsibilities outlined above are intended to define the general contents and requirements to perform this job. It is not to be taken as a complete statement of responsibilities or requirements. This job description does not restrict the Company’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job as needed.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
**How You Will Make An Impact**
 As a Senior Software Engineer in the Customer Platform team, you’ll own and evolve the systems that define how users interact with Epidemic Sound — including account management and entitlements across both individual creators and enterprise customers. We’re the system of record for account structures and what users are entitled to, ensuring the right experience reaches the right person, whether it's a solo artist or a global creative team.
   

  

 This foundational work enables us to deliver flexible, scalable experiences and underpins many of our commercial and product initiatives. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to a high-impact platform with visibility across the organization — shaping how we deliver enterprise-quality features and scale our offerings.
   

  

 We also foster a strong engineering culture grounded in openness and collaboration. You will regularly engage in pair and mob programming, as well as dedicated hack weeks for experimentation and learning. If you enjoy knowledge sharing and shaping a team’s direction in a fast-moving environment, you’ll feel right at home here.
   

  

**Your role will include, but not be limited to:**
* Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services primarily in Golang on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Champion technical excellence from system design and architecture through development, deployment, reliability, and security.
* Collaborate closely with frontend developers to deliver seamless React/Next.js-based interfaces for managing accounts.
* Partner closely with enterprise, commercial, and product teams to define requirements, prioritize features, and shape the product roadmap.
* Clearly communicate technical plans, challenges, and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


**Our Tech stack:**
 We’re evolving our platform toward modern backend technologies, primarily using:
   

  

* Golang (our core backend language)
* Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Kubernetes and Docker
* GitHub and GitHub Actions for version control and CI/CD
* Grafana for monitoring and observability
* Event-driven architecture, microservices, and React/Next.js for frontend interfaces


****What we’re looking for** 
 :**
* 5+ years of experience building and maintaining backend systems
* Proven experience in at least one backend language, such as Java, Node.js, Kotlin or Go, which demonstrates your ability to build and maintain mission-critical systems
* Strong grasp of distributed systems and system design principles
* Experience operating in cloud environments (GCP preferred, AWS also welcome)
* Experience working with modern CI/CD pipelines
* Willingness to work with Golang as we evolve in that direction
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate cross-functionally


**How you work:**
 You’re curious, proactive, and thoughtful. You enjoy solving real-world problems at scale and take pride in delivering reliable software. You’re someone who thrives in a dynamic environment, embraces uncertainty, and sees change as an opportunity to learn and adapt. You’re someone who:
   

  

* Navigates change with ease
* Shares knowledge generously
* Works collaboratively and transparently
* Thinks long-term while executing short-term


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below. Please note this role is full time based in Stockholm.
   

  

***Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound.***
***In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Rikard Herlitz, Chief Tech Officer where he shares what makes developers most happy, what velocity means to him and how Epidemic Sound is in the sweet spot when it comes to AI.***
***Thinking about joining us? Tune in - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Manager, Strategy & Corporate Finance
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slash energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Manager, Strategy & Corporate Finance, you will help shape Aira’s growth path by combining strategic analysis with financial execution. You will work on evaluating new business opportunities, supporting long-term capital strategy, and ensuring that financial resources are aligned with Aira’s ambitions.
   

  

 Reporting to the Chief Strategy Officer, you will contribute to strategic planning, build financial models to guide decision-making, and support fundraising processes. This is a hands-on role where you will prepare analyses, business cases, and materials that directly support leadership, the board, and investors.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Contribute to the development of new business segments, including market analysis, business case creation, and execution planning.
* Develop and maintain financial models to support decision-making, capital planning, and fundraising.
* Assist in planning and driving M&A and fundraising processes, including preparation of materials and coordination with external stakeholders.
* Prepare business updates, dashboards, and presentations for senior stakeholders, including the board and investors.
* Work closely with Strategy, Finance, and Commercial teams to align growth initiatives with capital resources and drive company-wide cross-functional projects


**What You’ll Bring To The Role**
* 3+ years of experience in investment banking, corporate finance, private equity, or similar fields.
* Strong skills in financial modelling, valuation, and strategic analysis, as well as experience supporting fundraising and M&A processes
* Genuine interest in go-to-market strategies and operational execution.
* Structured and analytical thinking with an ability to simplify complexity and drive decision-making.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, including experience working with senior stakeholders.
* An academic degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field.


**What’s In It for You?**
* Be at the heart of Aira’s growth journey, driving projects and innovations that shape the future of energy and climate technology.
* Gain hands-on leadership experience in a dynamic, entrepreneurial scale-up with a strong mission and global ambitions.
* Collaborate across countries and functions in a diverse, high-performing team.
* Influence decision-making at the highest level with exposure to board and investor dialogues.
* Work from our brand-new office in Stockholm, at Norra Stationsgatan 93—minutes from Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan.


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**What We Should Tell You About The Company**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating insanely
 **fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue** 
 , and are
 **backed by top-tier investors** 
 . We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say
 **“I was there when it all started.”**
 https://techcrunch.com/2025/05/21/filed-raises-17m-to-automate-the-drudgery-of-tax-prep/
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
 We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who moves fast and thrives in high-velocity environments. You’re the kind of person who sees a broken workflow, understands the root cause quickly, and ships a fix in hours—not weeks. You love turning ambiguity into working software, and you don’t wait around for perfect specs to start building.
   

  

 You’re a generalist who’s just as comfortable spinning up a backend service as you are crafting a clean, responsive UI. You sweat the details, but never let them block progress. You think in terms of speed, value, and iteration—always asking: how can we get this in front of users faster?
   

  

 As one of our earliest engineers, you’ll help shape the core product and infrastructure. You’ll work closely with design, ML, and actual tax pros to reinvent how this industry works—by shipping fast, learning fast, and doing what others said couldn’t be done.
   

  

 Our product and engineering team is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 . We’re prioritising local candidates, but will
 **consider candidates from elsewhere in the EU, who can travel to Stockholm.**
 ⸻
   

  

**Here’s Why This Is a Terrible Job**
* This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
* We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
* If you need a few extra days to perfect your code, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
* We use tools like Cursor to move fast, test ideas in days, and ship extremely fast.
* You’ll be operating at the intersection of product logic, machine learning, user psychology, and highly regulated workflows.
* There are no clear answers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and constant input from every direction.
* You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work? It is. And it’s not for everyone.


 ⸻
   

  

**Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make**
* We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
* We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
* You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast. And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
* You’ll ship code because you believe in it, not because it got signed off.
* You’ll talk to customers weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
* We’ll tell you what needs to be achieved. How you get there is on you.
* We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so dialed in that you can predict exactly what your user needs before you ever talk to them.
* That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


 ⸻
   

  

**The Teammate We're Looking For**
* Thrives at solving complex, technical product problems
* Moves seamlessly between systems thinking and detailed execution
* Excited by the challenge of serving multiple user groups and workflows
* No lone wolves — we need a collaborative engineer
* Big bonus if you have a track record of owning product outcomes, not just tasks


 ⸻
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* Architecting and building complex workflows across the full stack
* Co-owning the entire product experience from backend to frontend
* Driving product direction through technical execution and intuition
* Becoming an Oracle with a best-in-class customer model in your head


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Hard Skillset**
* Deep experience across backend and frontend systems
* Fluency in TypeScript, Python, or similar modern stacks
* Comfortable with infra, APIs, databases, and debugging messy edge cases
* Bonus if you’ve used AI tools to accelerate development
* Even bigger bonus if you’ve worked in regulated or high-trust domains


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Soft Skillset**
* Comfortable being uncomfortable and making calls with incomplete data
* Empathetic and curious — building for the user, not just for elegance
* Highly collaborative across product, design, and customer support
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic — you know when polish matters and when to move
* You own your work and welcome the accountability that comes with it


 ⸻
   

  

**Growth And Levels**
 We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
   

  

 We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
   

  

 This isn’t a comfy engineering role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.
   

  

 You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**The Process**
* Quick intro call (30 minutes)
* Code walkthrough and async task (60 minutes)
* Final round with our team (120 minutes)


 In just 3.5 hours, you’ll be wanting early access, just like the rest of our team—to dive into the codebase and help build a generational company, even before you start as you'll be able to see the opportunity to transform your career.
   

  

 Compensation Range: $82.5K - $143K

title: Freelancer MLOps Engineer
description:
**Who we are?**
 Besedo is a fast-growing tech company offering content moderation tools and services to online marketplaces around the world. Every year, we review and moderate over 500 million pieces of user-generated content and block 40 million fraud attempts.
   

  

 Besedo has headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden) and employs over 400 employees in 5 offices in different continents. Implio is our all-in-one SaaS moderation platform that combines state-of-the-art AI (deep learning, NLP, computer vision) with a powerful user interface for human moderation and statistics. The result is an easy-to-use content moderation solution that leads classified, dating and sharing economy sites from all around the world to love and trust.
   

  

 Learn more about Implio in this video, and about Besedo on our website.
   

  

 Come and make the internet better and safer with us!
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you an experienced MLOps looking for a new challenge and opportunity to learn in a great working environment? If you are a highly-motivated individual with a passion for large SaaS applications and AI at scale, we have the perfect job for you!
   

  

**About This Position**
 You will work with a team of talented Machine Learning Engineer DevOps and Developer who are passionate about their work and like to have fun in the process.
   

  

**Your mission**
**Role**
 As an MLOps Engineer and a member of the Data Science team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our machine learning lifecycle. You will be engaged in an array of daily tasks that involve:
   

  

* Collaborating with Data Scientists to convert experimental models into scalable production services, adopting practices such as A/B testing, Canary releases, and more.
* Ensuring seamless and automated deployment of models using CI/CD pipelines
* Implementing monitoring solutions for models' performance, and designing fallback plans for retraining and redeployment.
* Strategically managing resources (computational power and storage) to balance the performance of models, systems, and pipelines with cost effectiveness and efficiency.
* Designing, building, and maintaining Machine Learning (ML) pipelines to facilitate ML workflows, from data acquisition and processing to model deployment and monitoring.
* Implementing robust data validation strategies and methodologies to ensure data quality and reliability in ML models Staying updated with recent advances in MLOps, and identifying and implementing new technologies that can improve and optimize our machine learning system.


 You will be working in close collaboration with stakeholders: Data Scientists, DevOps, Front-end/Back-end Developers and Product Owner, to come up with the very best solutions.
   

  

**What it’s like working with us?**
 At Besedo, we all come from different cultures and backgrounds, but we share a common set of values:
   

  

* We like to get things done ✔️
* We support each other to reach our goals and grow as professionals 🤝
* We love to learn, share and have fun together 🎉
* We strive to offer a great work environment:


**Preferred Experience**
 ✅ We are looking for someone having worked for 3+ years or more as an MLOps, Engineer or in a related field and who has the following experience and skills:
   

  

* Proficiency in Python, and a strong understanding of Machine Learning libraries and frameworks such as PyTorch (preferred)
* Demonstrable experience with data structures, algorithms, and software design
* Hands-on experience with building, deploying, and maintaining machine learning models in a production environment
* Practical knowledge of containerization technologies (Docker) and orchestration systems (Kubernetes)
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools and version control systems (Git)


**✅ As a Person, You Are**
* Passionate about solving problems in an elegant and principled manner
* Enthusiast about team work, learning and teaching
* Detail-oriented, outgoing and a good communicator
* Fluent in English (French is not mandatory)


**🎯 Extra Points If You Have Experience With**
* Proficiency in Distributed Computing on different environments and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Experience with Workflow Orchestration tools, such as Prefect or Airflow

title: Projektledare
job_function: Consulting, Project Management, and Information Technology
description:
Har du erfarenhet av projektledning av IT-system och är redo att bli en del av en ledande CRM-leverantör med stora tillväxtambitioner i Europa? Välkommen på en spännande resa med Lime!
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
 Som projektledare ansvarar du för att driva kundprojekt som tar våra kunder till nya höjder. Du ansvarar för hela implementationsprocessen och stöttar kunderna löpande för att säkerställa att de får ut maximalt affärsvärde av sin CRM-investering.
   

  

 Mer konkret handlar det om att:
   

  

* Hålla möten och workshops för att identifiera och kravställa kundens behov
* Planera och driva projekten i dialog med involverade parter såväl internt som externt
* Säkra projektleverans och utbilda slutanvändare
* Rådge och leda kunderna i att effektivisera sina processer och arbetssätt med Lime CRM som stöd
* Göra enklare anpassningar i systemet och skräddarsy den tekniska kundlösningen tillsammans med Limes applikationsutvecklare
* Proaktivt arbeta med projektstyrning, tid och kvalitet - alltid med fokus på kundvärde och långsiktiga relationer


 För att lyckas krävs det att du arbetar strukturerat och målfokuserat samt är van vid att leda projekt med kunden i fokus. För att skapa värde för kunderna är det viktigt att du förstår produktens möjligheter och hur nya funktioner kan stärka deras verksamhet.
   

  

 Projektens storlek varierar mellan 2–18 månader och du kommer att arbeta parallellt med nya projekt och långsiktiga förvaltningsprojekt med några av våra större kunder. Att bygga relationer med kunderna är på så vis en central del av rollen.
   

  

 När du inte är ute på kundbesök utgår du från vårt kontor i Stockholm och blir en del av vår Expert Services-avdelning med cirka 175 kollegor i Europa. Detta är en konsultroll där du kommer att jobba mot en uppsatt budget och individuella debiteringsmål.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Vem är du?**
* Du har mellan 4-7 års arbetslivserfarenhet, varav minst 2 år av projektledning inom mjukvaruimplementationer
* Du har ett affärstänk och en generell verksamhetsförståelse
* Du tar ägandeskap i dialog med kund och är van vid att jobba med flera olika intressenter och stakeholders
* Du kan omvandla problem, processer och behov till kreativa lösningar och konkreta förslag
* Du har en akademisk utbildning
* Du talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat
* Du har körkort


**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 Helt ödmjukt kan vi berätta att vi har en fantastisk kultur på Lime!
   

  

 Vi firar framgång och när vi når våra mål bjuder vi med alla kollegor på en stor sommarfest. Vi har utöver det en årlig julfest, frukost varje måndag, daglig trefika med gofika på fredagar samt wellness- och aktivitetsgrupper på respektive kontor som anordnar gemensamma aktiviteter. Vi tycker om att umgås med varandra – att ha kul och att prestera går hos oss hand i hand!
   

  

 Förutom allt detta erbjuder vi kollektivavtal, sex veckors semester, friskvårdsbidrag, pension samt stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
   

  

**Processen?**
 Vi tillämpar löpande urval, vilket innebär att vi driver rekryteringsprocessen kontinuerligt tills vi hittat den där handen-i-handsken-matchningen. I första steget screenar vi på din ansökan. Därefter följer intervjuer, ett praktiskt case samt referenstagning. Vår process avslutas alltid med slutintervju med vår VD Nils.

title: Embedded Software Architect Product Platforms Getinge Critical Care
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 Getinge Critical Care in Solna is now strengthening our product development organization with an Embedded software architect for our new Platform Development team. At Critical Care we develop tomorrow’s intensive care products and equipment, and we are in an intensive period of change and expansion. In this role you will be a key player within our R&D organization and will take an active part in shaping our future products and technical solutions.
   

  

 The position offers you a great opportunity to make a difference in the architecture of our future products.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 We are developing the most advanced ventilators in the world. To continue this vision, we need a software architect to drive and implement embedded solutions for our future products. We seek an individual with a passion for software and electronics, who is not afraid to get their hands dirty.
   

  

**Why this role matters**
* Be one of the drivers in our new Platform Development core team.
* Design, implement and develop a future-proof, modular platform for new medical devices.
* Build and guide a high-performing core team — aligning technical, operational, and business goals in a software context.
* Drive execution end-to-end — balancing innovation, regulatory demands, and speed-to-market. Make high-impact decisions daily while keeping priorities clear and momentum strong.


**Your Main Responsibilities And Tasks Will Be**
* Be part of the core team in a groundbreaking development program to ensure the creation of the world's best medical devices.
* Develop and own the software architecture in complex embedded medical devices, including connectivity to external systems.
* Develop modular and robust embedded software that can be effectively enhanced and maintained in the future.
* Ensure that software methodologies and tools are effective, fast, robust, and compliant.
* Hands-on work with software is essential. Developing robust and future-proof embedded software will require interaction with stakeholders, architectural work, and developing software and hardware.


 The position is based at our site in Solna but offers the flexibility to work from home when suitable. The role requires occasional international travel. You will be reporting to the Head of Platform Development in Critical Care.
   

  

**You will bring**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree within Engineering
* 10+ years’ experience of software development, including work in highly regulated industry (med-tech, automotive, or high-tech preferred).
* Strong leadership that unites cross-functional teams behind a bold vision.
* Deep technical know-how in embedded systems, software, electronics, and mechanics.
* Expertise in distributed embedded systems based on Linux and embedded OS's.
* Proficient in CI/CD pipelines and automated test frameworks, including hardware integration. Experience in self-test and production test systems.
* Proven success managing both internal and external development partners.
* Hands-on experience with agile methodologies and modern product-development processes.
* Fluent English. Swedish (or willingness to learn) is an advantage.
* Exposure to regulated environments (ISO 13485 / FDA 21 CFR 820) is highly meritorious.


 To succeed in this position, you need to be an entrepreneurial, decisive leader who thrives in fast-paced settings. You turn ambitious ideas into reality, inspire teams, and navigate obstacles to deliver cutting-edge products that save lives.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible, but no later than 2025-10-10. We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Johan Widman at johan.widman@getinge.com or Talent Acquisition Manager Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com .
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Natural Resources Underwriter_ Sweden
description:
**Company Description**
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
 Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
   

  

*In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.*
**Purpose Of The Role**
 Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Natural Resources Underwriter to join our team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Natural Resources.
   

  

 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
   

  

 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
   

  

 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Contractors All Risks and Power Generation risks associated with Natural Resources. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing, and retention budget.
   

  

 You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:
   

  

* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Natural Resources portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives for each underwriting year.
* Assisting in underwriting CAR/EAR and B&M LOBs to achieving underwriting profitability.


**Qualifications**
**Qualifications :**
* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within construction , power generation or property underwriting, the insurance market, and competitors.
* Degree in Engineering or technical experience background with an interest for new technologies.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish (or another Nordic language) and high level of English written as well as spoken.


**Why You Want To Work At Chubb**
* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.


 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Anna Källs,** 
 Country Manager Sweden,
   

  

 anna.källs@chubb.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Stockholms tingsrätt söker en eller flera rådmän
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   


 Vi söker dig som vill ha ett stimulerande och omväxlande arbete i en miljö där du kommer att utvecklas och trivas.
 


  


 Stockholms tingsrätt är landets största tingsrätt och är indelad i fem dömande avdelningar, varav en innefattar Patent- och marknadsdomstolen som har en vakans. En placering på Patent- och marknadsdomstolen innebär att man ibland kan döma även på andra avdelningar.
 


  


 Tingsrätten avgör många omfattande och uppmärksammade mål, inklusive stora kommersiella tvister. Du kommer därför att arbeta i en professionell och välfungerande organisation där du utgör en viktig del i arbetet att ge tillgång till rättslig prövning på ett rättssäkert och effektivt sätt.
 


  


 Arbetsplatsen präglas av kompetenta och engagerade medarbetare som tar ett stort ansvar för att tingsrätten ska vara en attraktiv arbetsplats. En viktig del av det dagliga samarbetet på tingsrätten är domarnas arbete med handledning av fiskaler, notarier och andra personalkategorier.
 


  


 Tingsrätten arbetar aktivt med att utveckla verksamheten i samarbete mellan alla personalkategorier och avsätter tid för sådant arbete varje månad. En ledstjärna i utvecklingsarbetet är att skapa en sammanhållen tingsrätt med en hög grad av tillgänglighet och ett gott bemötande.
 


  

 Kvalifikationer m.m. 
   


 Du som söker ska lockas av ett mycket kvalificerat och varierande arbete där din juridiska skicklighet och analysförmåga utmanas. Du förväntas ha förmåga att entusiasmera dina medarbetare, mycket god förmåga att samarbeta med alla personalkategorier och ett intresse för att handleda bl.a. unga jurister. Vi värdesätter att du vill bidra till tingsrättens utvecklingsarbete. Det ställs även höga krav på ditt omdöme och din förmåga att arbeta självständigt.
 


  


 Du ska motsvara de krav som ställs i Domarnämndens kravprofil för ordinarie domare. Kravprofilen hittar via länken.
 


  


 Det finns goda möjligheter till individuellt anpassad fort- och vidareutbildning bl.a. inom ramen för Domstolsakademin.
 


  

 Om Stockholms tingsrätt
   


 Stockholms tingsrätt har drygt 300 medarbetare och är centralt belägen i Rådhuset på Kungsholmen.
 


  


 Domstolen avgör brottmål, tvistemål och familjemål och är dessutom särskilt forum för vissa måltyper. Avdelningen som innefattar Patent- och marknadsdomstolen handlägger – utöver målen vid den domstolen – främst brottmål och en liten del allmänna tvistemål. Utöver de fem dömande avdelningarna har domstolen en enhet där arbetet genomförs enligt särskilda rutiner för snabbspår för tvistemål.
 


  


 Tingsrättens chefsrådmän leder arbetet på de dömande avdelningarna och enheten för snabbspår. Avdelningarna har ca 35-60 medarbetare. På varje avdelning arbetar en chefsrådman och minst åtta rådmän, varav en är chefsrådmannens ställföreträdare. Rådmännen arbetar i nära samarbete med avdelningens fiskaler, notarier, beredningsjurister, domstolshandläggare och, på avdelning 5, patentråd.
 


  


 Tingsrättens administrativa avdelning leds av en administrativ direktör. Den administrativa avdelningen ansvarar bl.a. för registratur, HR-, ekonomi-, IT- arkiv- och servicefrågor vid domstolen.
 


  

 Övriga upplysningar
   


 Ordinarie domare anställs med fullmakt.
 


  


 Skriftlig ansökan med meritförteckning och övriga handlingar som den sökande önskar åberopa ska ges in till Domarnämnden. Använd den blankett som tagits fram för ändamålet. Blanketten finns tillgänglig via länken.
 


  


 Domarnämnden kommer att hämta in skriftliga yttranden från de referenser som anges. Det är därför viktigt att deras adresser (gärna e-post) anges.

title: Senior Finance Business Partner - Nordics
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced and strategic Senior Finance Business Partner to join LeoVegas Group, part of MGM Resorts International. In this role, you will work closely with the Nordics leadership team to provide financial insights and drive business performance for the Nordic markets and brands. You will be instrumental in shaping financial strategy, and supporting strategic decision-making in a fast-paced, competitive environment.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Collaborating with the Nordics executive team to develop and implement financial strategies that align with business objectives.
* Provide actionable insights to support growth, investment decisions, and operational improvements.
* Act as a key liaison between Finance and other business units to ensure cohesive strategy execution.
* Develop and maintain robust financial models and dashboards to monitor business performance, risks, and opportunities.
* Drive the budgeting, forecasting, and monthly/quarterly reporting processes for the Nordic countries.
* Prepare detailed financial reports and presentations for senior management and external stakeholders.
* Identify opportunities to enhance financial processes and systems, driving automation and efficiency.
* Contribute to group best practices across all financial operations.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 Essential skills:
   

  

* A minimum of 5+ years of progressive experience in financial management or business partnering roles.
* Demonstrable experience in a senior finance role within a fast-paced, digital, or regulated environment. Experience in the online gambling or gaming sector is highly desirable.
* Exceptional analytical and financial modelling skills with advanced proficiency in Excel and BI systems such as Tableau, as well as familiarity with ERP systems.
* Strong ability to communicate complex financial information clearly and effectively to both financial and non-financial stakeholders.
* A proactive and strategic mindset with a track record of driving process improvements and supporting business transformation.
* Ability to build strong cross-functional relationships and a strong understanding of commercial aspects in a fast-paced industry. High level of accuracy, integrity, and attention to detail, with a commitment to excellence in financial reporting and compliance.


 Nice to have skills:
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry or other tech related industries.


 WHO ARE WE?
   

  

 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1900 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices world-wide.
   

  

 BENEFITS:
   

  

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 If you think you would be a good fit for the Leo pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Creative Patternmaker
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As Creative Patternmaker at our Stockholm Office you will be responsible for delivering high quality patterns to our in-house atelier or suppliers for the designated product group. In this role, you will take full ownership of pattern quality - from sketch handover to production launch. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and external partners. Strong communication skills and technical expertise in patternmaking and garment construction are essential for this role.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

 As a Creative Patternmaker your main contribution will be to create high quality patterns. You will report to Senior Head Patternmaker and be located in Stockholm. This is a temporary position for 8 months, starting in January 2026.
   

  

 Please submit your portfolio with your application.
   

  

 You will play a vital role by:
   

  

* Participating in fit sessions and provide proactive input to ensure further development and production processes run smoothly
* Being responsible for pattern quality from sketch handover to production launch
* Interacting closely with in-house atelier regarding construction and finishings
* Working closely with cross functional partners of the designated product group during the development process, show preparations and production phase
* Serving as a technical resource to product development and design teams
* Contributing during the development process and production phase to ensure consistency in sizing and grading in close cross functional collaboration


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* Organized, detail-oriented with strong follow-through
* Cooperative, positive mind set and a team player
* Ability to efficiently work towards tight deadlines


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* Academic degree within design and/or patternmaking
* Minimum 4-6 years’ experience as a patternmaker preferably in an international high-end fashion brand
* Strong communication skills in written and spoken English with a good command of English technical terms
* Technical expertise in patternmaking and garment construction
* Good understanding of the creative process and creative in experimental pattern solutions
* Proficient in a CAD pattern software (Gerber, Lectra, etc.) and CLO
* Fluent in English


 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

description:

 Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients.  Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Natural Resources Underwriter to join our team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Natural Resources.
   

  

 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
   

  

 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
   

  

 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Contractors All Risks and Power Generation risks associated with Natural Resources. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing, and retention budget.
   

  

 You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:
   

  

* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Natural Resources portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives for each underwriting year.
* Assisting in underwriting CAR/EAR and B&M LOBs to achieving underwriting profitability.


**Qualifications**
**Qualifications :**
* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within construction , power generation or property underwriting, the insurance market, and competitors.
* Degree in Engineering or technical experience background with an interest for new technologies.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish (or another Nordic language) and high level of English written as well as spoken.


**Why You Want To Work At Chubb**
* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.


 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Anna Källs,** 
 Country Manager Sweden,
   

  

 anna.källs@chubb.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Tjänsteansvarig arkitekt för klientlösningar
description:
**Har du god samordningsförmåga kombinerat med teknisk kompetens inom klientlösningar? Värnar du om att de tjänster som du ansvarar för motsvarar verksamhetens behov? Hos oss får du möjlighet att använda din kompetens där den verkligen gör skillnad. Tillsammans med ett erfaret team är du med och skapar lösningar som gör avtryck – både idag och i framtiden.**
**Om tjänsten**
 Som tjänsteansvarig arkitekt för FMV:s klient och klientplattform arbetar du i huvudsak för att eftersträva en säker, robust och ändamålsenlig IT-tjänst. Du samordnar det interna arbetet och beroendet till tjänster inom eget eller närliggande tjänsteområden som gemensamt bygger upp tjänsten. Du ser till att tjänsten dokumenteras, skapar arkitekturbeskrivningar, förvaltningsplaner och roadmaps samt ansvarar för exekvering av dessa.
   

  

 Tjänsten du kommer vara ansvarig för befinner sig i en förflyttningsresa från IT-komponenter till att bli mer tjänsteorienterad och det kommer finnas goda möjligheter att påverka både utformningen och innehållet.
   

  

 Du arbetsleds av en tjänsteområdesansvarig och kommer att ingå i en organisation som är gemensamt intresserad, delaktig och ansvarstagande för förekommande informationssystem, tjänster, processer och rutiner. Vid behov stödjer du även andra projekt inom infrastrukturstaben. Rollen innefattar inget personalansvar.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm och tjänsteresor förekommer.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har minst en gymnasieutbildning. Du har några års relevant och aktuell erfarenhet som arkitekt inom klientområdet eller motsvarande (exempelvis klientarkitekt, tjänsteansvarig, infrastrukturarkitekt eller erfaren IT-specialist). Du har även erfarenhet av styrning mot verksamhet, leverantör och interna resurser samt kunskap avseende leverans av IT-tjänster.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har teknisk utbildning inom klientlösningar, såsom SCCM, imagehantering och applikationspaketering. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av budgetering och ekonomisk uppföljning. Har du tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta som IT-specialist med inriktning mot klientlösningar så tror vi att du har en kortare uppstartssträcka.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi positivt på om du har teknisk kompetens och erfarenhet av klientlösningar baserade på Windows, samt erfarenhet av att ha arbetat enligt ITIL. Har du erfarenhet av säkerhetsarbete och kunskap om informationssäkerhetsarbete samt om utveckling och drift av Windows-baserade klientlösningar är det en fördel men inget krav.
   

  

 Du har även god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Personliga egenskaper är av stor vikt för oss. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och söker dig som har en initiativförmåga och viljan och förmågan att lära och utvecklas. I grunden är du strukturerad och stabil samtidigt som du har förmågan att se helheten. Vidare är du en utpräglad lagspelare och relaterar till andra på ett lyhört och smidigt sätt. Du skapar även kontakter och underhåller dina relationer.
   

  

**FMV – Försvarets materielverk**
 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi har i uppdrag att förse det svenska försvaret med den senaste tekniken och kunskapen så att de kan försvara vårt land och våra allierade. Tillsammans med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor får du vara med och utveckla och upphandla det som ibland inte existerar än. Du driver utvecklingen, hela vägen från behov till leverans. Från idé till verklighet.
   

  

 Infrastrukturstaben ansvarar för myndighetens IT-verksamhet, informationsförvaltning och fastighetsförvaltning.
   

  

 Hos FMV erbjuds du en trygg anställning med bra förmåner:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter
* Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till distansarbete i den mån arbetet tillåter
* Tjänstepension och friskvårdsbidrag


 Läs mer om FMV som arbetsgivare och om de förmåner vi erbjuder på vår hemsida: Arbeta på FMV.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-10-02.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
* Du ansöker genom att bifoga ditt CV, betyg och intyg på svenska. I ditt CV beskriver du tydligt på vilket sätt du uppfyller efterfrågade kvalifikationer och meriter. För en mer inkluderande rekryteringsprocess tar vi inte emot några personliga brev.
* Vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat och bedömer kandidater utifrån rollens krav på erfarenhet, kompetens och personliga egenskaper.
* Våra fackliga företrädare är Stefan Hållander (SACO-S), Peter Andersson (SEKO), Lars Carlsson (OFR/O) och Madeleine Lithander (OFR/S). Alla nås på telefon 08-782 40 00 (FMV Växel).
* Vid frågor om tjänsten kan du kontakta rekryterande chef Peter Svahn via FMV:s växel: 08-782 4000. Kontakta Johanna Samuelson johanna.samuelson@fmv.se vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen.


 LI-JS1
   

  

 För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till befattningen tas endast emot via FMV:s webbplats eller registratur. Vi har gjort vårt medieval och undanber oss därför försäljning av annons- och rekryteringstjänster
