title: Influence Tech - Bloom 26
description:
**Influence Tech’s graduate program, Bloom, for tech management consultants**


You’ll learn your craft alongside some of the best, most experienced consultants in the business – and get the chance to make suggestions, shake things up and forge your own career path.


In August 2026, Influence Tech will once again run its graduate program Bloom together with our Newground Alliance consulting company partners. The program will kick-start your career and provide you with opportunities to support real project deliverables, engage directly with clients, and explore how tech can enable business value. The program will equip you with the skills needed to succeed in your career as a tech management consultant and allow you to explore exciting areas of emerging technologies.


To read more about the Bloom program and what you will learn, visit **A unique career - Newground Alliance - Bloom**.

 **Who are we looking for?**


Management consultants at Influence Tech are entrepreneurial, driven by solving complex problems and exploring the intersection between technology, people, and business. We are looking for individuals who are curious, driven and have great analytical and collaborative skills. To thrive and succeed in the role we believe that you are brave, innovative, and a person that takes initiative. You have a higher education at master’s level and you communicate fluently in both Swedish and English.

**What we can offer**

* The opportunity to work on exciting projects in small teams, in the areas such as automation, AI, data, cloud, and architecture
* You will be supporting and driving deliverables for exciting and innovative tech projects
* You get to work alongside industry experts within the tech management sector
* To work in a flat hierarchal company with a focus on other things than administration and internal processes
* A culture that is warm and friendly as well as a lot of social activities
* To work at a company that values work/life balance

**Who we are and what we do**


We are Tech Management Consultants. Creating value by tech expertise and collective intelligence. Combining technology and data capabilities with a human-centric approach. We ensure correct strategies and business goal alignment when delivering technology projects, establishing services, and providing technology leadership. Within the company, there is an entrepreneurial mindset and you as an employee have great opportunities to make a difference and setting a footprint.


To read more about who we are and what we do visit **A unique career - Influence Tech**.

**The recruitment process**



* Application


* Testing


* First interview


* Recruitment day


* Final interview


* Offer



Our selection process has started and the last day to apply to the program is 2025-11-23. Please submit your application today since selection is done continuously, so don't miss your chance to join Influence Tech!


If you have any questions about the program, our company, or the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact **talent@influencetech.se**.


Does Influence Tech sound like a good match for you? Apply now!


Are you looking for a different specialization? Visit **Newground Alliance** for other opportunities within Bloom26.


#InfluenceTech

title: Product Manager Common Functions- Tietoevry Industry (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description **Product Manager Common Functions—Tietoevry Industry (m/f/d)**


We are a leading integration service provider, enabling digital ecosystems through scalable, secure, and high-performance integration solutions. As we continue to grow and expand our product portfolio, we are looking for a Product Manager for Common Functions to drive the product development and evolution of cross-cutting capabilities that empower all our offerings.

**Department Overview**

The Nexus unit plays a crucial role in facilitating efficient payments, invoicing, and document handling on behalf of our customers. We aim to provide a seamless experience for our customers, ensuring that their business processes flow smoothly.


Approximately 400 employees are working towards this service area, and the department is responsible for optimizing processes from purchase to pay, resulting in an enhanced customer experience.

**As** **Product Manager for Common Functions**, you will be responsible for defining and managing shared features and services that are used across multiple products in our portfolio. These functions include user management, archiving, communication layers, internal support functions (e.g. billing) and also customer facing functionality such as tracking, portals, reporting, API lifecycle components, and more.


You’ll work closely with other Product Managers, Architects, and Engineering teams to ensure that shared capabilities are robust, scalable, and aligned with the needs of our internal and external stakeholders.  



**Key Responsibilities:**

* Define and maintain the vision, roadmap, and backlog for common capabilities, being the bridge in between the product managers
* Collaborate with product and development teams to understand the shared needs, align on the common goals and ensure reuse and consistency
* Responsible for prioritizing development needs balancing among business impact, strategic goals, and technical feasibility
* Ensure that shared capabilities meet non-functional requirements such as performance, reliability, and security
* Collaborate with the product owners and agile development teams to ensure timely and high-quality delivery
* Advocate for a common function mindset across the organization
* Be responsible for the cost allocation for common function teams and have the business case responsibility

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience as a Product Manager or similar product management experience leading in complex and cross-functional business context, ideally both from the B2B and B2C side of the business
* Strong understanding of one platform thinking and shared product strategy
* Ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear business value
* Skilled in stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration
* Experience working in Agile environments with tools like Jira, Confluence, etc.
* Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken), additional Nordic language is a bonus
* Financial know-how
* Organizational and coordination skills
* Experience with cloud-native services (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a bonus
* Familiarity with regulatory and compliance aspects (GDPR, ISO standards)

**What We Offer:**

* Professional growth, meaningful projects, and a good work-life balance
* Flexible working arrangements, including the ability to work remotely
* International working environment with experienced colleagues
* Inclusive and supportive community focused on diversity and innovation
* A central role in shaping the core of our common functions
* Opportunities for growth and influence in a fast-moving domain
* Join a company with many satisfied customers within consumer finance, banks, insurance, utility and public sector

**Benefits:**

* Opportunities for professional growth and career development
* Collaborative and inclusive work environment
* Flexible working arrangements
* Health and wellness benefits

**Apply now!**


If you’re excited by the idea of building the foundation that enables products to scale, adapt, and thrive — we’d love to hear from you.

  

Additional Information  

At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.

title: Senior Enterprise Architect - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description **At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**

 **About us**


Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.

  

We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from healthcare to social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.

 **About the role**


We are looking for a strategic and visionary Enterprise Architect who can define, lead, and align our technology strategy across the entire healthcare platform ecosystem. In this role, you will

* Set the architectural direction for our platform products
* Oversee alignment across different products
* Ensure long-term scalability, interoperability, and maintainability
* Support international expansion into the wider European healthcare market

 **You will engage directly with**

* Customers to explore new clinical and operational workflows, and digital transformation needs
* Partners to co-develop, integrate, and ensure compatibility within a modular platform ecosystem
* Product Management and Product Owners to align architectural vision with product strategies and roadmaps

 **As an Enterprise Architect, you will**

* Define and evolve the enterprise-wide architecture for our healthcare platform products
* Align architecture across product teams, domains, and business stakeholders
* Drive adherence to healthcare standards such as openEHR, FHIR, and HL7
* Lead strategic architectural initiatives such as modularization, capability-based planning, and platform evolution
* Govern architecture principles and ensure compliance across all layers (business, application, data, and infrastructure)
* Act as a key advisor to business and product leadership regarding technology roadmaps and transformation programs
* Guide solution and software architects and foster collaboration across multidisciplinary teams
* Contribute to technology partner strategies, vendor evaluations, and interoperability initiatives

 **We are looking for someone with:**

* Broad experience in enterprise architecture across complex product ecosystems
* Deep understanding of architecture principles / frameworks
* Proven ability to align business and technology strategies
* Familiarity with open digital health platforms and healthcare-specific standards (openEHR, FHIR)
* Experience designing scalable and modular architecture in cloud-native and containerized environments
* Leadership experience in driving change and enterprise-wide architecture governance
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, including international and partner collaboration

 **As a person you are:**

* Strategic in your thinking and system-minded
* Collaborative and able to work across different teams, organizations and cultures
* Committed to excellence and long-term impact
* Curious, open-minded, and adaptable

 **What’s in it for you?**


With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.

  

Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ twice a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.

title: Senior Enterprise Architect - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description **At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**

 **About us**


Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.

  

We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from healthcare to social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.

 **About the role**


We are looking for a strategic and visionary Enterprise Architect who can define, lead, and align our technology strategy across the entire healthcare platform ecosystem. In this role, you will

* Set the architectural direction for our platform products
* Oversee alignment across different products
* Ensure long-term scalability, interoperability, and maintainability
* Support international expansion into the wider European healthcare market

 **You will engage directly with**

* Customers to explore new clinical and operational workflows, and digital transformation needs
* Partners to co-develop, integrate, and ensure compatibility within a modular platform ecosystem
* Product Management and Product Owners to align architectural vision with product strategies and roadmaps

 **As an Enterprise Architect, you will**

* Define and evolve the enterprise-wide architecture for our healthcare platform products
* Align architecture across product teams, domains, and business stakeholders
* Drive adherence to healthcare standards such as openEHR, FHIR, and HL7
* Lead strategic architectural initiatives such as modularization, capability-based planning, and platform evolution
* Govern architecture principles and ensure compliance across all layers (business, application, data, and infrastructure)
* Act as a key advisor to business and product leadership regarding technology roadmaps and transformation programs
* Guide solution and software architects and foster collaboration across multidisciplinary teams
* Contribute to technology partner strategies, vendor evaluations, and interoperability initiatives

 **We are looking for someone with:**

* Broad experience in enterprise architecture across complex product ecosystems
* Deep understanding of architecture principles / frameworks
* Proven ability to align business and technology strategies
* Familiarity with open digital health platforms and healthcare-specific standards (openEHR, FHIR)
* Experience designing scalable and modular architecture in cloud-native and containerized environments
* Leadership experience in driving change and enterprise-wide architecture governance
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, including international and partner collaboration

 **As a person you are:**

* Strategic in your thinking and system-minded
* Collaborative and able to work across different teams, organizations and cultures
* Committed to excellence and long-term impact
* Curious, open-minded, and adaptable

 **What’s in it for you?**


With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.

  

Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ twice a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.

 **Could you be our new colleague?**


We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Kari-Antti Kuosa (kari-antti.kuosa@tietoevry.com)

title: Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description **Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)**

  

We are looking for a **Strategic Product Manager** who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.

 **When joining Tietoevry Banking you will work on:**

* **Product Vision and Strategy:** Develop and communicate a clear product vision and mid-term/long-term strategy that aligns with the company's overall Strategy, objectives and market trends. Define target customers, licensing and pricing models to address predictable long-term revenue flow. Define complementary services to support successful implementation and maintenance, ensure additional revenue flow.
* **Market Analysis:** Conduct in-depth market research to understand industry trends, competitive landscape, regulatory changes and customer needs, providing input and recommendations for strategic decisions for mid-term and long-term initiatives. Identify opportunities for product innovation and differentiation.
* **Roadmap Development:** Ability to translate market needs and business opportunities to a strategic roadmap and balance long/short-term needs. Create and maintain a high-level product roadmap that outlines key milestones, deliverables, and timelines, ensuring alignment with business priorities. Address product lifecycles, including planning sunsetting and migration strategies. Define innovation inception approaches. Plan portfolio modernization to fit market needs, ensure future growth and competitive costs.
* **Relationship Building:** Establish and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, partners, and industry influencers to create new business opportunities. Participate, present and be influencer in conferences, industry workgroups. Build relationships with industry stakeholders globally. Demonstrate cultural awareness and the ability to adapt product strategies to various regional requirements.
* **Stakeholder management:** Collaborate closely with the sales team and engage with other departments, including engineering, marketing, project management and customer teams, to support with sales and ensure successful product development and launch. Cooperate cross-units in Cards and Transaction Banking and other units in Banking.
* **Customer Insights:** Prepare and present vision, pitches, and presentations to existing and potential clients and partners, effectively communicating the value proposition. Gather and analyze customer feedback and usage data to inform product decisions and enhance user experience.
* **Performance Metrics:** Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and identify areas for improvement, ensure data-based decision making. Keep accountability on product/service profitability. Align models and use cross unit template and processes.
* **Go-to-Market Strategy:** Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market strategies for product launches and updates. Collaborate with Security, Compliance and Privacy teams to identify market or country potential risks and opportunities.
* **Risk Management:** Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.
* **Leadership and Mentorship:** Provide guidance and mentorship to product managers and team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.

 **Who we are looking for:**

* A Bachelor's degree in business, Marketing, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience in product management, with a focus on strategic planning and execution.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience in Cards and Payments, with a large network of connections with industry experts and decision-makers.
* Familiarity with European and Nordic customers.

 **We also believe you have:**

* Strong strategic thinking skills to develop and implement effective product strategies.
* A market and customer focus that drives product innovation and meets customer needs.
* Excellent relationship-building abilities to establish connections with clients, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Proficiency in public speaking to effectively present ideas and influence audiences.
* Strong negotiation and influencing skills to advocate for product initiatives and secure buy-in.
* A creative mindset that fosters innovation and the development of unique solutions.
* A results-oriented approach that emphasizes accountability and achievement of product goals.

  

As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.

 **What we offer:**

* We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, an open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance!
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
* Competitive salary (up to 7,000 EUR gross per month in Latvia), based on experience and qualifications.
* Finally, we believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.

 **Did we get you inspired?**

  

We look forward to your application! Interviews will be held continuously, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at recruitmentinbanking@tietoevry.com.


Hope to hear from you soon!

  

Location: Rīga - Verde, Roberta Hirša 1

 *On specific positions, we might perform background checks.*

 **About Tietoevry**

  

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.


Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion, and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiarize yourself with what we do.

  

Additional Information  

At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.

* **Performance Metrics:** Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and identify areas for improvement, ensure data-based decision making. Keep accountability on product/service profitability. Align models and use cross unit template and processes.
* **Go-to-Market Strategy:** Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market strategies for product launches and updates. Collaborate with Security, Compliance and Privacy teams to identify market or country potential risks and opportunities.
* **Risk Management:** Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.
* **Leadership and Mentorship:** Provide guidance and mentorship to product managers and team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.

 **Who we are looking for:**

* A Bachelor's degree in business, Marketing, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience in product management, with a focus on strategic planning and execution.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience in Cards and Payments, with a large network of connections with industry experts and decision-makers.
* Familiarity with European and Nordic customers.

 **We also believe you have:**

* Strong strategic thinking skills to develop and implement effective product strategies.
* A market and customer focus that drives product innovation and meets customer needs.
* Excellent relationship-building abilities to establish connections with clients, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Proficiency in public speaking to effectively present ideas and influence audiences.
* Strong negotiation and influencing skills to advocate for product initiatives and secure buy-in.
* A creative mindset that fosters innovation and the development of unique solutions.
* A results-oriented approach that emphasizes accountability and achievement of product goals.

  

As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.

 **What we offer:**

* We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, an open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance!
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
* Competitive salary (up to 7,000 EUR gross per month in Latvia), based on experience and qualifications.
* Finally, we believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.

 **Did we get you inspired?**

  

We look forward to your application! Interviews will be held continuously, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at recruitmentinbanking@tietoevry.com.


Hope to hear from you soon!

  

Location: Rīga - Verde, Roberta Hirša 1

 *On specific positions, we might perform background checks.*

 **About Tietoevry**

  

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.


Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion, and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiarize yourself with what we do.

  

Additional Information  

At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.

title: Verksamhetskonsult- Tietoevry Industry (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description **Verksamhetskonsult** **HR&Lönesystem- Tietoevry Industry (m/f/d)**


Vill du få möjlighet att ligga i framkant med tekniken? Många företag kämpar för att hänga med i den snabba utvecklingen, vi på Tietoevry vill leda den. Den ena dagen blir inte den andra lik när du hela tiden får testa ny teknik. Våra innovativa partnerskap och kunder inom privat och offentlig sektor gör att du samtidigt får vara med och forma den digitala framtiden.

 **I din roll** **som V**erksamhetskonsult


Som verksamhetskonsult är du väl insatt i kundens verksamhet och förstår deras specifika utmaningar och behov. Du kommer initialt att arbeta med support, konsultation, applikationsdrift och systemadministration.

  

På sikt kommer du att ansvara för utbildningar av användare hos våra kunder och delta i införandeprojekt. I din roll kommer du även att ställa krav och föreslå förbättringar för att vidareutveckla och anpassa applikationen så att den ger maximal kundnytta.

 **Är du den vi söker?**


Vi söker dig med ett stort engagemang och som vill arbeta med support och konsultation för vårt HR-system mot kommunal sektor, eCompanion. Du kommer att arbeta i ett team med verksamhetskonsulter/supportmedarbetare och systemutvecklare där ni är vår primära kontaktyta mot kunderna.

 **Vi ser gärna att du:**

* har några års erfarenhet av arbete med HR-system, löner och löneadministration (helst inom kommunala avtalsområdet).
* har erfarenhet av systemadministration
* har förmågan att snabbt kunna se olika lösningar på problem och att arbeta med flera processer samtidigt.
* är både serviceinriktad och kundfokuserad.
* är öppen för att lära dig nytt, även inom teknikområdet.
* har god samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga.
* erfarenhet kring systemet eCompanion är meriterande.

 **Vi erbjuder dig**


Vår storlek är vår styrka. Som Nordens största IT-företag erbjuder vi dig fler möjligheter än likvärdiga företag. Vi har stor geografisk spridning i Sverige och världen – våra kunder är små som stora, välkända som okända, lokala som globala. Vår bredd, tillsammans med höga förändringstakt, ger dig kraft att utvecklas. Vi strävar efter att vara en modern och attraktiv arbetsplats. Därför bygger vi arbetsgrupper med stor mångfald för att ta tillvara och utveckla kompetens och nytänkande. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta.

  

Customer successteamet sitter samlade mitt i Uppsala, närmare bestämt i det före detta Mejeriet, Storgatan 19, fem minuters promenadväg från resecentrum.

 **Låter det intressant?**


Välkommen med din ansökan i form av ett personligt brev och CV genom att klicka på “Skicka ansökan”. Vi behandlar ansökningarna fortlöpande och ser gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Om du har ytterligare frågor om rollen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Annika Sagbrant, annika.sagbrant@tietoevry.com.

  

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

 *Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*

*Tietoevry avböjer samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*

 **Om Tietoevry**


Tietoevry skapar meningsfull teknologi som bidrar till att göra världen bättre. Vi är ett ledande techbolag med lång historia och närvaro i Norden men har också global kapacitet. Baserat på våra kärnvärden öppenhet, trovärdighet och mångfald, jobbar vi tillsammans med våra kunder – och utvecklar en digital framtid där företag, samhällen och människor kan växa.

  

Våra 24 000 experter globalt specialiserar sig på cloud, data och mjukvara för tusentals företag och organisationer inom privat och offentlig sektor i mer än 90 länder. Tietoevry omsätter årligen cirka 3 miljarder euro och företagets aktier är noterade på NASDAQ-börsen i Helsingfors och Stockholm samt på Oslo Børs.

  

Additional Information  

At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.

title: Azure Virtual Desktop Specialist
description:
**A Z U R E V I R T U A L D E S K T O P S P E C I A L I S T**  

**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**  

Full-time | Permanent | Team Workspace

 **A B O U T X E N I T**  

Xenit is a growth company which specializes in Cloud and Modern Work. Our committed employees inspire, challenge and encourage each other, while providing extensive value for our customers. Xenit is **Microsoft's Partner of the Year, Sweden** for 2024, illustrating our commitment to technical development, being on the cutting edge of tech, and our close partnership with Microsoft.

 *Fun fact: Team Manager, Victor Nasslander, was also voted Xenit's* ***f******avourite manage****r for 2024*

  

**W H A T W E N E E D**  

We're on the hunt for a consultant who is specialised in **Azure Virtual Desktop.**  

At Xenit, we have two teams who typically look for Azure based competence - Our **Cloud Infrastructure Team**, and our **Workspace team.** The Workspace team is responsible for managing the Xenit AVD feature service, which you will have the opportunity to continuously develop and improve, as well as implementing solutions for our external customers. Like most people with sense, we hate carrying out the same task time and time again, so you will make sure to streamline and automate anything that *can* be automated.  

  

**Examples of potential tasks:**  

* Managing customers' AVD environments (including incident management, change management and developing environments).
* Participating in projects with a focus on implementation and set up of Virtual Workspace solutions
* Acting as a general Azure resource in other consulting assignments (dependent on level of Azure expertise)

  

**C O U L D Y O U B E A M A T C H ?**  

**We believe our next AVD/Citrix Specialist has:**  

* 3+ years of experience within Microsoft Azure; preferably within Azure Virtual Desktop, perhaps Azure Compute, Virtualization & Scalability
* Experience with cloud migration, transition or transformation projects
* Experience with Citrix or other virtual environments
* General skills within Infrastructure: Windows Server, Linux, Networking, Security

  

**It is a bonus if you have:**  

* Skills within Automation
* Relevant certifications/education
  

Right: Expert Engineer, Hanessa and left: Team Manager, Victor Nasslander **We also believe that you are a person who:**  

* Acts on their own initiative, makes things happen and takes **responsibility** for their own work/successes/failures.


- Has their head in the clouds - a "cloud first" approach ️  

* Is hungry to be better and to excel within their career
* **Fluent** in spoken and written Swedish and English
* Above all else, displays kindness and compassion in everything they do
  

**W H Y C H O O S E X E N I T ?**  

**Benefits**  

Xenit boasts a large benefits package, read full list here.  

  

**Super interesting colleagues**  

With us you will find spinning instructors, parkour practitioners, gamers, art historians, rugby players, puzzle maniacs, film geeks and much more.  

With us, you are free to be who you are. Our workforce is so diverse, that one of the only things each person has in common is an incredible drive and passion for what they do.  

  

**Activities**  

Each quarter, we host **Xenit Inspire** where employees are able to share specialist knowledge, information about cool projects, and take part in tasks centered around innovation - workshops and hackathons. We also offer annual conferences, team building, after works, and "Bring a Buddy" lunches at the office.  

  

Last year, Xenit was awarded **"Career Company of 2024"**. This prestigious recognition underscores our commitment to fostering a workplace culture that values inclusivity, well-being, and growth.  

*"Xenit is an outstanding employer where corporate culture and well-being are at the center. Here, the employees are part of a warm and inclusive community where their well-being and well-being are prioritized. By offering an environment where collaboration, creativity and innovation are encouraged, employees can thrive and develop while contributing to the company's success."*  

**Read more about Karriar Företagen** **here****.**

  

If you have questions about the position or the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact our Head of Talent: Abigail Chapman
  

Read more here: https://xenit.se/

title: Data Scientist
description:
**About Us**
 With over 85 million global active users and 2 million transactions per day, Klarna is on the way to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop. To help us get there, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent team—accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We’re looking for people ready to achieve the extraordinary and embrace our bold ambitions as we shape the future of payments and fintech. Will you join us?
   

  

**What We Do**
* Build, deploy, and maintain forecasting and analytics models. The scope includes the full P&L and balance sheet (e.g., transactions, revenue, receivables).
* Own the end-to-end model lifecycle: problem framing, data sourcing, feature engineering, modeling, validation, documentation, versioning, and monitoring.
* Design driver-based and hierarchical forecasts, and reconcile outputs across markets and products to ensure consistency between the P&L, balance sheet, and cash flow.
* Develop scenario, sensitivity, and stress-testing tools to support the annual plan, monthly forecasts, and in-month outlooks.
* Partner with teams across the company to translate business questions into measurable models and decisions.
* Productionize solutions in Klarna’s cloud environment (Python/SQL), automating reliable, reproducible pipelines with Airflow and Docker.
* Create clear narratives, dashboards, and variance bridges that explain model outputs and drivers to finance leadership.
* Champion best practices in clean, maintainable code, data governance, and model risk controls.


**Who You Are**
* A data scientist with a ML background, proficient in Python and SQL, and comfortable shipping production code in the cloud (AWS) with Git/CI.
* Skilled in forecasting methods - both classical and ML-based forecasting with experience tuning.
* Structured and execution-oriented; able to define problems, prioritize, and deliver end-to-end with high autonomy.
* A clear communicator who can simplify complex topics for non-technical stakeholders.
* Excited to learn from and contribute to a team that actively experiments with cutting-edge tools and AI agents, and motivated to explore how such innovations can enhance day-to-day finance and analytics work.
* An academic background in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, Engineering).


**Awesome to have**
* Experience in fintech/e-commerce or consumer finance; familiarity with payments, receivables, and funding mechanics.
* AWS experience (e.g., Batch, Lambda, Step Functions, EC2, S3) and workflow orchestration (e.g., Airflow); containers (Docker).
* MLOps practices for monitoring/backtesting, drift detection, and alerting; and experimentation design.


****Closing****
 To ensure fairness and maintain global market competitiveness, each role in a specific location has a set base salary. During the recruitment process, we will assess your skills and experience to determine which role is the best fit for you.
   

  

 Please include a CV in English.
   

  

 Since 2005, Klarna has been on a mission to reimagine how consumers spend and save in their daily lives. We help people save time and money and reduce financial worry. With over 85 million global active users and 2.5 million transactions per day, our vision is a world where Klarna empowers everyone, everywhere, through seamless financial and commerce experiences—as a personalized, trusted assistant making financial empowerment effortless.
   

  

 Over 575,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store.

title: Solution Architect to Telenor
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you'll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most - relationships between people.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As an Architect, you are a forward-looking, ambitious generalist with a strong interest in both business and technology. You will navigate between strategic discussions and operational execution, adapting to multiple challenges across many fields and technologies. With deep technical expertise and hands-on experience in software and/or product development from ideation to production and beyond, you take a holistic approach in system design - understanding how people, business processes, and applications interact to drive company success.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Drive Measurable Impact - You will impact customer experience, optimize business and IT efficiency, and accelerate time to market by designing scalable, resilient, and future-proof systems. Your architectural guidance will directly influence strategic funding decisions and investment priorities while ensuring technology aligns with business goals.
* Empower Stakeholders - You will act as a trusted advisor to business and technical teams, providing guidance on key decisions, requirement creation, and technology strategy. By producing high-value architectural deliverables and fostering strong stakeholder collaboration, you will help prepare teams for disruptive events and long-term success.
* Build the Architecture Discipline - You will drive architectural excellence by mentoring colleagues, shaping technical direction, and championing best practices across the organization. Through governance, process improvements, and a challenger mindset, you will develop a strong architectural culture, ensuring alignment with business objectives while fostering continuous learning.


**Who You Are**
 Behaviors
   

  

* You are a problem solver who likes complex, dynamic environments.
* You are growth-minded, constantly learning, and leading by influence and clarity rather than authority.
* You value transparency, collaboration, and integrity


 Hard Skills
   

  

* Expertise across multiple technologies and architectural domains.
* Strong knowledge of cloud-native architectures, distributed systems, event-driven design, and API strategy.
* Experience in data-driven decision-making and interest in AI/ML integration.
* Scalable system design, optimizing performance, security, and resilience while balancing long-term strategy with execution.
* Big Plus: Experience with workflow orchestration, rule engines, Spring Boot, and Vue.js.


 Soft Skills
   

  

* Effective communicator and storyteller - able to simplify and communicate around complex, ambiguous projects.
* Critical thinker and adaptable leader - able to navigate evolving business and technology landscapes.
* Proactive and collaborative - foster a high-performing technical culture, mentor lead developers, and drive architectural excellence with clarity and purpose.


**Our promise to you**
*We are better together.*
 Here, you'll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other's backs through ups and downs.
   

  

*We support relationships and societies.*
 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

*We make room for life.*
 Work from home up to two days a week, where your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. You also get two 'give-me-a-break' days per year for extra time off, and our flexible working hours help you balance your time. We also support you through every stage of life with our benefits package.
   

  

*We invite you to a career in motion.*
 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you'll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. When you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don't wait-reach out today.
   

  

 In this recruitment, Telenor collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultants Anki Snis anki.snis@se.experis.com, +46 70-3775969 and Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75.
   

  

 Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 We look forward to receive your application!
   

  

**Good to know**
 As part of Telenor's policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Regional Vice President, Enterprise Sales
description:
Harness is a high-growth company that is disrupting the software delivery market. Our mission is to enable the 30 million software developers in the world to deliver code to their users reliably, efficiently, securely and quickly, increasing customers’ pace of innovation while improving the developer experience. We offer solutions for every step of the software delivery lifecycle to build, test, secure, deploy and manage reliability, feature flags and cloud costs. The Harness Software Delivery Platform includes modules for CI, CD, Cloud Cost Management, Feature Flags, Service Reliability Management, Security Testing Orchestration, Chaos Engineering, Software Engineering Insights and continues to expand at an incredibly fast pace.
   

  

 Harness is led by technologist and entrepreneur Jyoti Bansal, who founded AppDynamics and sold it to Cisco for $3.7B. We’re backed with $425M in venture financing from top-tier VC and strategic firms, including J.P. Morgan, Capital One Ventures, Citi Ventures, ServiceNow, Splunk Ventures, Norwest Venture Partners, Adage Capital Partners, Balyasny Asset Management, Gaingels, Harmonic Growth Partners, Menlo Ventures, IVP, Unusual Ventures, GV (formerly Google Ventures), Alkeon Capital, Battery Ventures, Sorenson Capital, Thomvest Ventures and Silicon Valley Bank.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The Regional Vice President is a front line sales leader who will leads a team of Enterprise Account Executives. This role will be responsible for running a regional plan, building out the territory, developing Enterprise Account Executives within the region, while implementing a strong sales methodology, working complex enterprise sales cycles, while focused on the Harness software and services.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Meet or exceed monthly, quarterly and yearly revenue targets
* Develop and execute a comprehensive regional plan
* Accelerate customer adoption
* Continually build and grow a robust sales pipeline
* Work with partners to extend reach & drive adoption
* Lead contract negotiations
* Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
* Ensure customer happiness and success
* Help to recruit and build Nordics sales team


**About You**
* At least 3 years formal sales leadership experience building and leading high performance sales teams.
* High career trajectory and potential.
* Someone with experience in a start-up environment.
* Consistent overachievement in previous roles.
* Significant enterprise sales and strategic customer development experience.
* Experience practicing and implementing a sales methodology, such as MEDDIC.
* Track record in closing large, complex deals across verticals in the Fortune 500.
* History of accurate forecasting and business reporting.
* Experience in working with Salesforce and other sales oriented tracking tools.


**Work Location**
* This role will be based in Stockholm, Sweden


**Harness In The News**
* Harness AI Tackles Software Development’s Real Bottleneck
* After 'Vibe Coding' Comes 'Vibe Testing' (Almost)
* Startup Within a Startup: Empowering Intrapreneurs for Scalable Innovation - Jyoti Bansal (Harness)
* Jyoti Bansal, Harness | theCUBEd Awards
* Eight years after selling AppDynamics to Cisco, Jyoti Bansal is pursuing an unusual merger
* Harness snags Split.io, as it goes all in on feature flags and experiments
* Exclusive: Jyoti Bansal-led Harness has raised $150 million in debt financing


 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex or national origin.
   

  

**Note on Fraudulent Recruiting/Offers**
 We have become aware that there may be fraudulent recruiting attempts being made by people posing as representatives of Harness. These scams may involve fake job postings, unsolicited emails, or messages claiming to be from our recruiters or hiring managers.
   

  

 Please note, we do not ask for sensitive or financial information via chat, text, or social media, and any email communications will come from the domain @harness.io. Additionally, Harness will never ask for any payment, fee to be paid, or purchases to be made by a job applicant. All applicants are encouraged to apply directly to our open jobs via our website. Interviews are generally conducted via Zoom video conference unless the candidate requests other accommodations.
   

  

 If you believe that you have been the target of an interview/offer scam by someone posing as a representative of Harness, please do not provide any personal or financial information and contact us immediately at security@harness.io. You can also find additional information about this type of scam and report any fraudulent employment offers via the Federal Trade Commission’s website (https://consumer.ftc.gov/articles/job-scams), or you can contact your local law enforcement agency.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **ML Engineer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 We’re looking for a ML Engineer who’s excited about using data and technology to shape how millions of people experience entertainment. At Viaplay, our ML team works at the heart of personalization, customer engagement, and product innovation.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll contribute to building and improving the machine learning models and systems that power our platform. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers, data scientists, and product teams to bring ideas to life — from recommending the right content to understanding our users better. This is a great opportunity if you enjoy problem-solving, learning, and making a real impact in a supportive, collaborative environment.
   

  

**What** 
**You’ll** 
**Be Doing**
* Design, train, and deploy machine learning models for recommendations, predictions, and classifications
* Collaborate with product, engineering, content, commercial, marketing to turn business needs into ML-powered solutions
* Build and maintain reliable ML pipelines in a modern, cloud-based environment
* Monitor and evaluate models to ensure they perform well and fairly in production
* Share knowledge, learn from others, and contribute to a culture of experimentation and curiosity


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* 3+ years of hands-on experience applying ML or Data Science in a production setting
* Experience working on projects end-to-end: defining problems, prototyping, deploying, and monitoring
* Proficiency in Python and SQL, experience with data transformation using Spark
* Knowledge of data pipeline orchestration tools such as Airflow (or similar)
* Clear communication skills, you can explain complex topics in a way others understand
* A focus on building ML systems that are reliable, understandable, and sustainable
* A background in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent practical experience


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience with recommender systems or personalization
* Familiarity with A/B testing or causal inference
* Knowledge of MLOps practices (CI/CD for ML, monitoring, observability)
* Experience in media, streaming, or e-commerce


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with three days a week in the office and the rest remote, giving you the best of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: CRM Marketing Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
**Circle K** 
 is looking for:
   

  

**CRM Marketing Specialist**
**Type of Employment:** 
 Permanent
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden or Copenhagen, Denmark
   

  

**Visa requirements:** 
 A valid work permit from the EU/EEA (relocation assistance is not provided)
   

  

**The Role**
 We're searching for a skilled Salesforce Account Engagement & Marketing Cloud Specialist to join our Global Salesforce team. If you're passionate about Salesforce & digital customer journeys, thrive in fast-paced environments, and love solving puzzles, then we want you on our team!
   

  

 We offer a work environment full of creativity, independence, and supportive colleagues. If you're someone who thrives in such an environment, then you'll fit right in.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage the creation and maintenance of our customer journey flow.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand new requirements and align on prioritization.
* Provide expert-level support to users, troubleshoot issues, and offer timely resolutions.
* Conduct training sessions for end-users and ensure ongoing system adoption.
* Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency within the Salesforce platform.
* Work closely with the commercial team to understand business requirements and translate them into Salesforce journey solutions.
* Lead and participate in Salesforce-related projects from initiation to completion.


**Personal Skills**
* Proactive, self-managed, and adaptable with a positive attitude in a fast-paced working environment.
* Eager to learn new things and develop skills.
* Team player, with strong relationship-building, interpersonal, and influencing skills.
* Excellent English oral and written communication skills – other languages are a plus.
* Interest in learning about business processes and systems.


**Functional Skills**
* Solid experience working within Marketing Cloud and/or Account Engagement
* Salesforce Certification in Marketing Cloud and/or Account Engagement
* Salesforce Administrator is a plus, but not required.
* Experience in Project Management or Project Teams.


**Are you interested?**
 Apply by
 **September 25th, 2025.**
 We are evaluating applications as they come and hire when the right candidate is found, so please send application and CV in English as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions to the job advertisement don’t hesitate to contact Anne Gronemann:
   

  

 Email: agro@circlekeurope.com
   

  

 Phone: +45 20712798
   

  

 Our ambition is to be an exceptional place to work. We will put our very best effort into your personal and professional development – because when you grow, we grow. We know great companies are built from within, by great people like you.
 **Come grow with us!**

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
I
 **Stretch Beyond** 
 använder vi använder Microsofts väletablerade verktyg och tekniker för data och analytics till att utveckla lösningar som är hållbara över tid. Med dessa tar vi in, bearbetar och tillgängliggör data på ett strukturerat sätt enligt våra kunders behov och förväntningar. Centralt för oss är att vi tror att data också spelar en viktig roll i omställningen till mer hållbara affärsmodeller, och självklart ser du också potentialen i datadriven effektivisering.
   

  

 Hos oss kommer du kreativt få rita upp nya lösningar, förverkliga dem hands-on och se effekten av ditt arbete, som exempelvis mer energieffektiva sjukhus. Du kan förvänta dig en arbetsplats i högt tempo där du får ta stort eget ansvar i omväxlande och utmanande åtaganden där vi hjälper varandra att skapa de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder.
   

  

 Om du vill vara med i början av ett nytt geografiskt område i ett väletablerat konsultbolag finns här en riktig möjlighet att bidra med din djupa kompetens. Du får vara med från grunden men har tryggheten och den sociala samvaron som är en självklarhet i Stretchgruppen. Vi erbjuder dig en naturlig plats i vardagen och möjligheten att göra skillnad.
   

  

 Hos oss är det okej med flexibilitet, vi sitter gärna tillsammans med våra syskonbolag på Gamla Brogatan 26 eller ute hos kund men samarbetar väl digitalt också.
   

  

 För den här rollen behöver du behärska både engelska och svenska samt ha flerårig erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsofts verktyg.
   

  

**Vi tror att du som person...**
* Är en noggrann problemlösare som inte ger dig
* Gillar tekniska utmaningar
* Intresserar dig för ny teknik
* Vill både dela med dig av din kunskap och lära av andra
* Uppskattar högt tempo


**Erfarenheter som hjälper dig att lyckas i denna roll...**
* Datahantering i Azure, Synapse, Databricks, Fabric eller motsvarande
* Spark
* Power BI
* Avancerad SQL
* Python
* Relevant utbildning och längre arbetslivserfarenhet
* Konsulterfarenhet och/eller projekterfarenhet


 Läs gärna mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Hälsar teamet på Stretch Beyond

title: Integration Specialist – Stockholm
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Design Services
description:
Befinner du dig i ett flow när du får jobba med systemintegration och moderna API-centriska lösningar? Kanske trivs du ännu mer då du får jobba med trevliga teammedlemmar och ha kul tillsammans i utmanande uppdrag? Vi vill nu bli fler i vårt Connectivity-team i Sverige – kanske är du vår nästa kollega?
   

  

 På Solita har vi över 20 års erfarenhet av integration och processautomation – och vår passion för att hjälpa kunder att skapa robusta, skalbara och framtidssäkra lösningar är lika stark idag som när vi började. Våra integrationsspecialister arbetar nära våra kunder för att förstå deras unika behov. Genom att använda den senaste tekniken inom API-design, molnintegration och DevOps säkerställer vi inte bara snabb leverans av affärsvärde, utan också effektiva kopplingar mellan system och dataflöden.
   

  

 En dag på Solita
   

  

 En dag på Solita kan ofta börja med ett standup-möte med kund och dina team-medlemmar, där ni planerar dagens arbete, går igenom prioriteringar och identifierar eventuella utmaningar. Sen kliver du in i ditt arbete: kanske jobbar du med att utveckla integrationer och API:er i exempelvis Azure, migrera integrationer mellan olika plattformar, eller fokuserar på att skissa upp en integrationslösning baserat på en kravspec. Under dagen kan det dyka upp ad-hoc möten med kund eller kollegor som behöver stöttning i sitt arbete. Ofta innebär det att lösa problem: kanske behöver du felsöka en oväntad driftstörning, identifiera en flaskhals i ett integrationsflöde eller hitta en ny väg för att möta kundens krav.
   

  

 Du kan också delta i våra interna utbildningsmöten, så kallade infosessions, där vi delar kunskap om allt från nya teknologier till banbrytande arbetssätt. Dagen fortsätter med utveckling och kanske ett par korta avstämningar och inte minst – fika!
   

  

**Emma Fägerlind** 
 som jobbar som Integration Lead hos oss, beskriver sitt nuvarande uppdrag:
   

  

*“Mitt team bygger integrationer som ska stödja HR- och ekonomiprocesser för en kommun. Som integrationsledare har jag en blandad roll där jag både får arbeta med samordning, funktionskrav och teknisk lösning. Jag hjälper att ta fram specifikationer och förstå vad det är vi behöver göra för att lösa kundens behov. När är vi stöter på problem eller frågor försöker få jag teamet att komma framåt genom att lyfta frågor till relevanta parter.*
*Problemlösningen är det roligaste i mitt jobb – att få sätta sig in i nya flöden och tekniker och tillsammans med andra försöka hitta den lämpligaste lösningen. Det är fantastiskt att få vara del av ett team och se hur olika personers egenskaper bidrar på olika sätt till resultatet.”*
**Din roll som Integration Specialist**
 Hos Oss Får Du Möjligheten Att Jobba Teamorienterat i Meningsfulla Och Kundnära Projekt. Som Integrationskonsult Hos Oss Har Du Möjlighet Att Utvecklas Inom Följande Ansvarsområden
   

  

**Integration & API developer** 
 – Detta är en mer renodlad utvecklingsroll med fokus på att bygga och testa diverse molnbaserade integrations- och plattformslösningar. Du använder problemlösning och förståelse för affärsprocesser för att definiera optimala lösningar för kunder, samt ansvarar för implementeringen av lösningar enligt projektkraven. Tidigare erfarenhet av systemutveckling och förmåga att utveckla och implementera diverse integrationslösningar hjälper dig att ta dig an denna roll.
   

  

**Integration lead** 
 – I denna roll har du chansen att jobba närmare verksamheten där du i dialog med kundens verksamhet och andra system tar fram krav på integrationer, leder integrationsarbetet och tester av integrationer. Här ser vi gärna att du är familjär med integrationskoncept och har tidigare erfarenhet i en teknisk och kundnära roll där du jobbat med kravhantering samt teknisk design av integrationer.
   

  

**Integration architect** 
 – I denna roll fungerar du som stöd till kunden exempelvis beträffande integrationsstrategier, analys av befintliga system, och val av tekniker. Du designar och definierar den övergripande integrationsstrategin och arkitekturen, och tar hänsyn till långsiktiga mål och effekter av integrationsinitiativ. Du hjälper även till att sätta principer för integrationer. Du leder ofta ett team av integrationsspecialister och är involverad i implementeringen av lösningar. Här vore det bra om du har djupgående kunskap inom integrationsdomänen, teknisk uppsättning av plattformar och integrationsmönster – helst med fokus på molnbaserad integration.
   

  

 Vi jobbar främst med molnbaserade plattformar eller ramverk i molntekniker som Azure, GCP och AWS. Det är därmed meriterande om du har kunskap i DevOps, IaC, infrastruktur och nätverk. Några av de tekniker som ofta används i våra projekt inkluderar bl.a. Boomi, Workato, Azure Logic Apps, Azure API Management, Software AG (webMethods).
   

  

**Karriärbanor på Solita**
 Jobbet som konsult hos oss innebär ofta en brant utvecklingskurva och variation sett till både arbetsuppgifter och roller. Vi ser karriärbanor inte som en specifik trappa utan mer som ett landskap med flera möjliga individanpassade orienteringar, både i höjd- och sidled, inom ett flertal kompetensområden.
   

  

 Sam jobbar exempelvis idag som People Lead parallellt med sin roll som Service Delivery Manager.
   

  

 Lia har haft chansen att bära många hattar under sin tid hos oss – från developer till lead developer och arkitekt i både lokala och gränsöverskridande integrationsprojekt.
   

  

 Andrei har också utvecklats väldigt brett som scrum master, team/tech lead, SDM, arkitekt, projektledare och kravställare i ett större projekt de senaste 3 åren.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss. Vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

* Meningsfulla projekt: Arbeta i en agil miljö med varierande uppdrag där du kan påverka teknikval och arbetssätt för att skapa de bästa lösningarna
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete med flextider– läs mer från vår blogg.
* Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra medarbetare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
* Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom systemintegration, cloud och utveckling


 Utöver detta får du även ta del av följande
 **förmåner** 
 :
   

  

 💰 Fast lön oberoende av beläggningsgrad
   

  

 🏦 Pensionsavsättning i linje med ITP1 samt möjlighet till löneväxling till ditt pensionssparande vid inkomst över 8,07 inkomstbasbelopp
   

  

 🛋️ Möjligheter till flex för en god work-life-balance
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 🩺 Sjukvårdsförsäkring via Skandia för både din mentala och fysiska hälsa som täcker dig även utanför tjänstetid
   

  

 🏋️‍♀️ Friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr via Benifex (tidigare Benify).
   

  

 💻 Ett brett nätverk av erfarna specialister från olika områden inom tech att samarbeta med
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

 Vilka är vi?
   

  

 Solita är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2000 medarbetare i 9 länder, varav 230 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

**Intresserad av att höra mer?**
 Låter det som en spännande utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team som ligger i framkant inom systemintegration. Om du har några frågor, hör gärna av dig till Head of People & Culture Patrik Rafstedt (patrik.rafstedt(at)solita.se); People Lead Sam Odeh (sam.odeh(at)solita.se) eller rekryteringsansvarig Kajsa Törnroos (kajsa.tornroos(at)solita.se).
   

  

**Hur ser processen ut?**
 I rekryteringsprocessen tror vi på en gedigen och effektiv process. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Om vi ser en potentiell matchning, bjuder vi in dig till ett första möte för att lära känna dig och berätta mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar på Solita. I andra intervjun fokuserar vi på din tekniska kompetens och din erfarenhet. Om allt går bra tar vi oss vidare till sista steget där vi presenterar ett erbjudande och välkomnar dig som ny Solitan!
   

  

**Din arbetsplats kan vara belägen i Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö.**
 Sign up to our newsletter to hear about the latest news, upcoming events and open positions at Solita
   

  

 Subscribe

title: Software Developer (Consultant)
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Come work with us** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Software Development at Netlight?** 




 It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar. For example in web development? System development? Mobile Development? Data engineering? It is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like.
 



  





 As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.
 



  





 Our projects are in the fields such as Backend Development, Frontend Development, Web Development, System Development, Cloud, Mobile Development, Architecture, Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, Data Science, DevOps, Infrastructure, Cyber Security, Scrum Master, Agile Coaching, Product Owner, UX-/UI-/Interaction Design and more.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
* Verbal and written fluency in English
* 0,5-5 years of work experience related to IT



  





**Preferred Qualifications** 



* Proven Track-record from previous positions (e.g. recognized achievements & deliveries)
* Advanced/Bilingual (B2-C2) Swedish/Norwegian/Danish



  





**Application** 




 We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We try to get in touch within two weeks
 
 if
 
 we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 The Engine Tech Quality team is seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our technical quality team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and deploying data-driven solutions using existing and emergent tools and technologies to analyze large datasets and drive actionable improvements in our high-performance game engine code.
   

  

 You will work closely with cross-functional teams to help analyze and optimize, drive understanding and improve workflows across performance profiling, runtime memory management, and input latency measurements.
   

  

 Your work will have a strong impact on the players experience across multiple projects and activities within the Battlefield franchise.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Translate research outcomes into production-ready solutions and products, and take ownership of their long-term development, support, and continuous improvement.
* Collaborate with engineers, technical artists, technical scripters and other team members to build and deploy scalable tools and workflows.
* Design, develop, and maintain robust data pipelines and ETL processes for large-scale processing of performance profiling, memory management, latency measurement data and other technical quality areas.
* Apply advanced analytics and statistical techniques to extract insights from complex datasets related to game engine performance.
* Implement and optimize algorithms for predictive modeling, anomaly detection, and automation of technical quality metrics.
* Stay up to date with the latest advancements in machine learning, big data, and generative AI, and proactively apply new techniques to solve technical quality challenges in game development.
* Document technical designs, processes, and results to facilitate knowledge sharing and reproducibility.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
* Solid understanding of statistical and quantitative data analysis.
* Solid understanding of machine learning concepts, algorithms, and best practices.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, especially in the context of technical quality data.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C++, Java, or Scala.


**Skills And Experience**
* Experience working with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or distributed databases.
* Experience with traditional Machine Learning framework such as Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
* Experience with data analysis and manipulation tools such as Pandas, Polars, Koalas, etc.
* Experience creating effective data visualizations to communicate complex technical insights.
* Experience with tools like Tableau, Grafana, PowerBI, Streamlit, etc.
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) is a plus.
* Hands-on experience with MLOps practices for model management, deployment, monitoring, and tracking.
* Knowledge of data engineering principles and experience with large-scale data processing.
* Experience working with technical quality data such as performance profiling, runtime memory management, and input latency measurements in high-performance game engine code.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Self-driven with a strong sense of ownership and attention to detail.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


 Additional Information
   

  

* Passion for working with technical quality data and creating impactful solutions for game engine performance.
* Interest in continuous learning and professional development in the fields of machine learning, AI, and game technology.


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer.
